Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About ITsPeople

ITsPeople is a leading management and consulting firm specializing in guiding organizations through complex digital transformations and enhancing their organizational agility. We empower our clients to navigate and overcome intricate business challenges by leveraging data-driven insights and managing large-scale transformation projects. Our mission is to help companies strengthen their market position by adopting advanced data analytics and AI, fostering a culture of agility, and driving sustained operational excellence.

Role Overview

As a Data Scientist at ITsPeople, you will be instrumental in transforming data into actionable insights that support our clients' strategic objectives. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to solve complex problems, develop predictive models, and drive data-driven decision-making. This role is ideal for a highly analytical individual with a passion for uncovering patterns and insights from large datasets and communicating these findings effectively.

Key Responsibilities


Data Collection and Preparation: Gather, clean, and prepare large datasets from various sources for analysis, ensuring data quality and integrity.
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Conduct exploratory analyses to discover trends, patterns, and anomalies in data, providing valuable insights to stakeholders.
Predictive and Diagnostic Modeling: Develop, implement, and evaluate machine learning models and algorithms to predict outcomes and diagnose issues.
Machine Learning and AI: Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to build models that address business challenges and optimize processes.
Data Visualization and Reporting: Develop impactful visualizations and write comprehensive advisory reports to effectively communicate data insights and support informed decision-making.
Collaboration and Teamwork: Work closely with project teams, including data engineers, business analysts, and domain experts, to understand requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
Continuous Learning and Improvement: Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in data science and technology to continually improve methodologies and tools.


Required Qualifications


Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Experience: 1-5 years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related role. We welcome enthusiastic individuals looking to start or advance their career in data science.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming (Python), ETL processes (SQL), and data processing with tools like Jupyter Notebook, Databricks, and Tableau. Strong understanding of machine learning frameworks and advanced statistics. Experience with MATLAB, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, or similar tools and modules is a plus.
Soft Skills: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders and collaborate effectively within teams.
Language skills: Fluency in Dutch and English is required.


Personal Attributes


Analytical Mindset: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to derive meaningful insights from complex data sets.
Detail Oriented: Attention to detail in data analysis, modeling, and reporting, ensuring accuracy and reliability in all deliverables.
Proactive and Driven: Self-motivated and proactive in seeking out new challenges and opportunities to apply data science.
Team Player: Collaborative spirit with the ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary teams and contribute to a positive team dynamic.
Personal Leadership: Demonstrates initiative, responsibility, and the ability to lead and inspire others without formal authority.


Training and Development

At ITsPeople, we believe in the growth and development of our team members. We offer a robust training program designed to equip new and emerging professionals with the skills and knowledge needed to excel in their roles. Our comprehensive training covers the latest in data science techniques, tools, and industry best practices, providing you with the foundation to succeed and grow within our dynamic team.

Why Join ITsPeople?

Joining ITsPeople means being part of a vibrant and supportive team dedicated to driving transformative change for our clients through data-driven solutions. We value innovation, collaboration, and a customer-centric approach. As a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to work on high-impact projects, engage with a diverse range of clients, and contribute significantly to their success.

We offer a stimulating work environment that promotes professional development and personal growth. You will have the autonomy to manage your projects, collaborate with senior consultants, and play a key role in our data-driven strategies.

We guide organizations through complex transformations by focusing on people, processes, and technology. Offering end-to-end service delivery, our philosophy is to integrate and leverage internal resources, stimulating and motivating them to be an integral part of the transformation journey.

We guide organizations through complex transformations by focusing on people, processes, and technology. Offering end-to-end service delivery, our philosophy is to integrate and leverage internal resources, stimulating and motivating them to be an integral part of the transformation journey.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Knab was founded in 2012 because we wanted to do things differently. Simpler, smarter, and more advantageous for our customers. Because we believe we can help everyone maximize their financial affairs. "Feel at ease when it comes to your finances. Every day." By combining smart technical solutions with a healthy dose of human intelligence, we create financial services that really meet your needs. Add to that some of the sublime personal service from our employees and you end up with something that's truly unique to the world of finance!







In a nutshell

As a Data Scientist you are part of the analytical back-bone of Knab. You like to take on complex challenges and you are not afraid to get to the bottom of things but recognize situations where a swift solution is the best answer.







Your main responsibilities:

Apply statistical and machine learning algorithms to solve real business problems
Deliver models with high degree of quality (data preparation, modelling, testing and validation, documentation and deployment)
Conduct responsible AI (explainability, non-bias and fairness)
Interact cross-functionally, making business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders
Actively share your knowledge to help us grow as a team
Take ownership of your personal development







The department and team

The Expert Center Data and Analytics (ECDA) department consists of 40 dedicated data professionals with a big heart for the business value of Data. ECDA consists of five teams: Data Science and Analytics, Enterprise Data Office, Data architecture and modelling, Data Warehousing, Data Engineering & DBA. The department works with all functions of Knab and is Knab’s Center of Excellence for “all things data”.

We play a key role in managing Knab data as a strategic business asset, providing actionable insights and intelligent analytics, innovate with AI and enable Knab to become the data-driven #1 bank for entrepreneurs.

The Data Science consists of all communicative 'beta nerds' who get energized by complex business challenges.







Your Profile

There is no set route to become a great Data Scientist at Knab. But to be successful in this role, this is the kind of profile we have in mind:

PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Econometrics, Physics, Mathematics, Artificial intelligence, Business Analytics etc.)
2 years+ working experience in the field of Data Science with commercial models focus
Expertise in data science, statistics and machine learning techniques
Familiarity with casual inference is a plus.
Knowledge of the standard data science toolkit: Python, SQL, PyTorch, Pandas and MLOps framework
Proactive, driven to achieve results and flexible.
Can bring across a message clearly and concisely
Curious and avid learner
Is able to work under pressure in a focused and precise manner
Fluent in English




Diversity Statement: Come as you are. Knab is an open workplace with positive vibes. We are inclusive of all nationalities, races and genders. We feel comfortable to bring our authentic whole selves to work and like you to do so too.







Work with us!

If you come to work with us, Knab will become a significant part of your life. Therefore, we make sure the ambiance is just as exciting as your job.







If you have any questions regarding this role or the process, please feel free to reach out to us!




We don`t collaborate with third parties to fulfill this role.

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
I'm working with a boutique Data Consultancy company based in Amsterdam searching for brilliant Dutch & English fluent Ai Engineers to design, develop, and deploy cloud-native AI applications using AWS or Azure to aid clients in their ground-breaking projects.




This would be a permanent, hybrid position based in Amsterdam.




Key Responsibilities:

AI Application Development: Design and develop cloud-native AI applications using AWS or Azure ML services.
Software Engineering: Apply software engineering best practices to ensure high-quality code, including version control, testing, and documentation.
Data Visualization: Create informative dashboards using PowerBI or Amazon QuickSight to provide insights for stakeholders.
ML Model Development: Write efficient Python code using PyTorch to develop and deploy machine learning models.
AI Infrastructure: Implement monitoring, logging, and error handling mechanisms to ensure the reliability and performance of AI applications.
Cloud Architecture: Design scalable and maintainable cloud architectures to accommodate growing datasets and user demands.
Infrastructure as Code: Utilize IaC tools (Terraform, AWS CDK, Pulumi) to manage cloud infrastructure.
MLOps: Implement MLOps practices to streamline the deployment and management of machine learning models.
LLM Integration: Integrate Large Language Models (LLMs) and ChatBots into applications to enhance user experience.




Qualities:

Experience: At least 2+ years of experience with AWS or Azure, particularly in using their ML services.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python, PyTorch, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization tools.
Software Engineering: Strong background in software development, with a focus on best practices.
Cloud Technologies: Knowledge of cloud architecture, scalability, and maintainability.




We offer a great referral scheme! If you know someone who you may think will fit this role we offer a great referral pay-scheme :)




Keywords:

AWS, Amazon Web Service, Azure, AI Engineering, LLM, Chatbots, Data Science, Machine learning, Artificial intelligence.

Title: AI/Python Developer
Description:
Over het Bedrijf:

Wij zoeken een ervaren freelance AI/Python Developer die zich aansluit bij één van onze partners in Venlo binnen de Power Product teams. In deze teams werk je nauw samen met een developer, designer en product owner om innovatieve oplossingen te bouwen. De focus ligt op outcome-driven development, waarbij je actief meedenkt over wat we gaan bouwen om gebruikers direct te voorzien van antwoorden.




Over de Rol:

Je bent een vooruitstrevende probleemoplosser die uitstekend overweg kan met Python, data en AI-technologieën. Je bent communicatief sterk, klantgericht en niet bang om gesprekken met stakeholders te voeren om te begrijpen wat de beste oplossing is. Je werkt flexibel, 32-36 uur per week, waarvan dinsdag en donderdag op locatie in Venlo.




Verantwoordelijkheden:

Samenwerken met een developer, designer en product owner
Bouwen van innovatieve oplossingen
Actief meedenken over projecten
Communiceren met stakeholders




Vereiste Vaardigheden:

Uitstekende kennis van Python
Ervaring met data en AI-technologieën
Communicatief sterk
Klantgericht

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - LLM
Description:
LLM - Python for Machine Learning

Experience: 2 - 15 Years

Location- Permanent Remote Anywhere in the world

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 5 hours Mandatory overlap with PST

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years Mandatory

Mandatory Skills- Python: min 2 years, Python for Data Science: min 1 yr, Machine Learning: min 1 yr, PyTorch: min 1 yr, Keras: min 1 yr, Tensorflow: min 1 yr

Key skills: Python, ML, PyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow

Job Responsibilities


Develop, train, and deploy machine learning models using TensorFlow and/or PyTorch.
Implement machine learning models and preprocessing pipelines using Scikit-learn.
Apply supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, including SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forest, and k-NN, to solve complex problems.
Design and implement deep learning architectures such as CNNs, RNNs, GANs, and transfer learning models.
Explore and apply reinforcement learning techniques to enhance AI solutions.


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 2+ years of experience as a Python-focused Engineer.
1+ years of experience with Python-based frameworks for machine learning.
Proficiency in TensorFlow and/or PyTorch for model development and deployment.
Strong knowledge of Scikit-learn for machine learning model implementation.
In-depth understanding of supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, as well as deep learning architectures.


Nice To Have


Experience with Keras for quick prototyping of deep learning models.
Proficiency in Pandas and Numpy for data manipulation and preprocessing.
Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications in AI.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
What is the role about?

Bitvavo is actively expanding our Data Science team within the Compliance, Legal and Risk departments. We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist with specific expertise in these areas to join our growing team. This crucial role reinforces Bitvavo's commitment to leveraging data across regulatory and risk frameworks, enhancing our data-driven approach.

As an integral part of the data team, you will play a vital role in shaping the future of cryptocurrency trading. Your responsibilities will include generating analytical insights, building models, developing data products, improving data quality and standards for informed decision-making, and providing stakeholders with the information they need to optimise their operations. A significant focus of your role will be on building models and data products that drive strategic business decisions and operational efficiencies.

How will you make an impact?

Responsibilities

In your capacity as a Data Scientist, you will collaborate with Data Analysts, Analytics Engineers and Data Engineers to empower various business areas with data-driven insights. Your key responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:


Conducting comprehensive data analysis and building predictive models to tackle business challenges, uncover opportunities, and streamline processes in areas such as Risk, Fraud, Financial Crime, Compliance, and Operations
Establishing and nurturing partnerships with stakeholders to promote a culture of data-centric decision-making within Bitvavo
Leading the charge in data analytics and data science projects, from the planning stage through to execution, effectively turning insights into actionable strategies
Collaborating closely with the many product and engineering teams at Bitvavo to enhance data sets and pipelines in order to make Bitvavo more data-driven
Enabling the business by developing and deploying user-friendly self-service analytical tools, making them accessible to non-technical users and promoting widespread data utilization


How will you be successful?


At least 4 years of relevant experience in a Data Scientist/Quantitative Analyst role or similar, preferably with direct involvement in the CLR domain
Academic qualifications in STEM or related disciplines (Data Science, Computer Science or Econometrics)
Expertise in data analytics using scripting languages (SQL), BI tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI)
Solid command of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Tensorflow, Keras) for building predictive models and carrying out more sophisticated analyses
Enthusiasm for contributing to a fast-paced industry within a rapidly expanding company
Ability to simplify complex technical outcomes into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders
Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work across departments and with a wide range of stakeholders, bridging tech, product, and business needs to drive unified solutions


Bitvavo does not accept resumes from staffing, search, or recruitment firms without a signed agreement. If you send us a resume without such an agreement, we may contact the candidate directly without any obligation whatsoever and no fee of any kind will be paid should we hire the candidate.

Benefits

We care about our people. That's why we have a broad range of benefits to support them mentally, physically, and in their career growth. And an extra holiday for your birthday, just for fun.


Flexible well-being budget
Training and development budget
Competitive package
Hybrid working
Pension scheme
26 days holiday leave
Internet allowance
Mental health support platform
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist – Amsterdam

€5,000 - €6,500 Per Month




As a Senior Data Scientist you will work with the team on predicting conversion probabilities for a million customers. You will lead the development and implementation of advanced analytics solutions together with your team.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll:

Build, maintain and automate our statistic models
Developing and operationalizing machine learning solutions
Initiate quality and quantity research to understand our (potential) customers in a better way
Cooperate with marketeers, product owners and other stakeholders to design, to execute and analyze results of research and experiments
Inform and advise stakeholders over realized result and strategy




Main Requirements:

Masters degree in relevant subject and have 3+ years of relevant experience as Data Scientist.
Relevant experience with building and maintaining of statistics models and machine learning algorithms with SQL and Python.
Knowledge of AWS services and tools like Sagemaker and knowledge of Docker.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment, proactive, keen on innovation and a strategic and creative thinker.




About the team:

The team is building an International Analytics hub to provide the right models, tools, tech, and best-practices to help realize our growth ambition. In this hub you will be working together with business representatives to identify value adding business cases for advanced statistical analytics. You will be working on exciting and challenging BI, data & AI projects that create real impact for the lotteries and our beneficiary organizations.

Show more

  • Build, maintain and automate our statistic models
  • Developing and operationalizing machine learning solutions

The team is building an International Analytics hub to provide the right models, tools, tech, and best-practices to help realize our growth ambition. In this hub you will be working together with business representatives to identify value adding business cases for advanced statistical analytics. You will be working on exciting and challenging BI, data & AI projects that create real impact for the lotteries and our beneficiary organizations.

Title: AI Engineer - Netherlands
Description:
This is a remote position.

Note: One of our clients is building a new team and hiring 8 AI Engineers globally. This is a 100% remote role. This role does not offer any visa sponsorship.

Job Summary:

As an AI Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing AI models and algorithms that solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to integrate AI solutions into our products. Your role will involve researching the latest AI technologies, building scalable machine learning models, and optimizing algorithms for performance and accuracy.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and deploy AI models and algorithms that address business needs and challenges.
Collaborate with data scientists and software engineers to collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets.
Implement machine learning and deep learning models using frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
Optimize and tune models for performance, accuracy, and scalability.
Integrate AI solutions into production systems, ensuring seamless operation and reliability.
Research and stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and data science.
Develop and maintain documentation for AI models, processes, and best practices.
Participate in code reviews and provide feedback to ensure high-quality code and adherence to best practices.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to AI models and systems in production environments.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure AI solutions align with business goals and objectives.


Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in AI, machine learning, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Experience with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, or Scikit-learn.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, neural networks, natural language processing (NLP), and computer vision.
Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms and tools for AI and machine learning (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work with complex datasets.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Ability to manage multiple projects and deliver results on time.


Preferred Qualifications:


Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, generative models, or advanced neural architectures.
Familiarity with DevOps practices for AI/ML, including CI/CD pipelines and containerization.
Relevant certifications in AI or machine learning.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Functie­omschrijving

Vakmanschap staat bij jou voorop. Je past de nieuwste data science technieken toe om voorspellende analyses te ontwikkelen, valideren en realiseren. Iets waar je binnen het CJIB ook volop de ruimte voor krijgt!

Binnen het Innovatielab-team ga je werken aan datagedreven innovaties binnen het CJIB. We breiden uit; kom jij ons team versterken?

Wat ga je doen?

Als Junior Data Scientist werk je mee aan datagedreven innovaties om zo nog slimmer en persoonsgerichter te werken. Jij bent voortdurend bezig- en op zoek naar- de geldigheid en geschiktheid van data. Je onderzoekt welke potentie de data van het CJIB bevat.

Samen met je team ben je verantwoordelijk voor het onderzoeken, ontwikkelen en beschikbaar stellen van technieken, modellen en algoritmes die de operationele processen en maatschappelijke impact van het CJIB breed ondersteunen. Dit doe je volgens de geldende wet- en regelgeving en ethische richtlijnen op een wijze die uitlegbaar en transparant is voor de opdrachtgevers en stakeholders.

Je werkt mee aan creatieve, innovatieve en pragmatische oplossingen voor business vraagstukken. Je doet onderzoek naar nieuwe inzichten en presenteert de waarde en mogelijkheden van deze inzichten voor het CJIB. Gezamenlijk registreren, publiceren en monitoren jullie modellen in de Microsoft Azure ML Cloud omgeving. Tevens ondersteun jij de eindgebruiker bij het in gebruik nemen en optimaal benutten van het model.

Als Junior Data Scientist van het team Innovatielab ben je samen met het team een belangrijke sparringpartner voor stakeholders binnen de Business, IT en Data & Analytics bij geïmplementeerde AI-oplossingen en processen. Je ondersteunt bij monitoring van deze, werkt mee aan advies hierover en kom je gezamenlijk met pragmatische oplossingen welke je gezamenlijk implementeert.

Evert Colmer, Operationeel Manager vertelt. “Je komt te werken in een energiek team met veel kennis waarbij samenwerken als zeer belangrijk wordt ervaren. Het team maakt onder andere machinelearning prototypes om de waarde voor de organisatie aan te tonen. Bij een succesvolle pilot wordt in gezamenlijkheid met de business het prototype naar productie gebracht.”

Functie-eisen

Wat vraagt deze functie van jou?

Het team is volop in ontwikkeling, net als de rest van de organisatie. Dit maakt dat wij een collega zoeken die flexibel, creatief en gedreven is om nieuwe tools eigen te maken. Als er rekenkracht en analytisch denken nodig is, kloppen collega’s al snel bij jou aan voor hulp en advies. Dit komt doordat jij data of uitkomsten daarvan, ook al zijn deze complex, zowel schriftelijk, mondeling als visueel helder over weet te brengen. Je bent initiatiefrijk, ondernemend en doelbewust binnen de kaders van jouw werkzaamheden. Breder werken dan alleen je eigen takenpakket en daarmee écht samenwerken in het team ligt jou goed. Door deze eigenschappen in te zetten garandeer jij resultaten binnen jouw verantwoordelijkheden.

Dat jij voor een rol als deze gepassioneerd en geïnteresseerd bent in recente datagedreven ontwikkelingen en trends is vanzelfsprekend. Daarnaast ben jij een teamspeler die hoge eisen stelt aan het eigen werk en dat van het team. Jij zoekt voortdurend naar mogelijkheden om de kwaliteit te verbeteren en motiveert en coacht anderen om dit ook te doen. Energiek, gedreven, vasthoudend en helder in de communicatie zijn hierbij essentieel.

Om succesvol te zijn in deze functie zien wij daarnaast graag het volgende terug in jouw profiel:


Sterke analytische, creatieve en probleemoplossende vaardigheden, bewezen door een HBO of universitaire opleidingsachtergrond/ wo werk- denkniveau*.
Kennis van predictive modelling, machinelearning technieken, NLP, LLM’s, optimalisatie en in het vertalen van gedetailleerde data-analyse naar innovatieve producten;
Kennis van statistische en machinelearning technieken, programmeren en ontwikkelen in Python en SQL;
Kennis van ontwikkelen in Azure Machine Learning studio en Azure DevOps is een pre.
De voertaal is Nederlands. Daarom vragen we een goede beheersing daarvan in woord en geschrift.
Een (online) assessment kan onderdeel zijn van de procedure.


Arbeids­voorwaarden


Salaris­niveau


schaal 10



Maand­salaris: Min €3404 - Max €5389
Show more

Title: Data Scientist II
Description:
About the Team:

We are a key part of the Pricing Foundations team, responsible for optimizing and measuring the dynamics of our two-sided marketplace, impacting both our partners and customers. Our mission is to ensure high-quality supply by carefully analyzing the effects of our pricing products on these stakeholders. Through comprehensive performance measurement, we have become the first OTA (Online Travel Agency) capable of providing partners with personalized insights into how specific pricing products impact their business. Our work involves building a sophisticated data service that manages this process end-to-end—from running experiments and developing machine learning models to estimating the impact on each partner. This data-driven approach ensures that our partners' benefits are closely aligned with the interests of our customers. Our data team has a deep expertise in A/B testing, and strives to measure the impact of incentive offerings, and has strong track record in developing and maintaining data products and mature services. Our team is made up of Data Scientists and Analysts, working closely with engineering and machine learning teams within the track.

Key Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist Analytics Engineer, you will be in charge of the development, performance, quality, and scaling of our data and metrics generating pipelines. You will work closely with a team of Data Scientists and Analysts as well as product.


Develop scalable, flexible, and high-performance datasets and metrics by building data pipelines that process large amounts of data and power business critical decision making.
Partner with analysts, data scientists and product stakeholders on the data needs for metrics, dashboards, and analytic capabilities that will have the greatest impact on business decisions.
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions through your own work as well as acting as an intermediary for problems and connecting the work of software engineers to analytics stakeholders.
End-to-end ownership of data and metrics quality in your team’s datasets and pipelines.
Abstract patterns across dashboards and analyses in order to simplify and reuse code and data across the workflows involved. Optimize the analytics workflows to achieve scale and reliability.
Help drive the modernization of Booking’s analytics systems, partnering with the data platform teams to leverage and influence the latest technologies. Be a force for keeping data and systems current with the latest technologies.



Years of relevant Job Knowledge.Years of relevant Job Knowledge


Broad Job Knowledge (3 - 5 years)



Requirements Of Special Knowledge/skills


Professional experience in the broad field of Data Engineering and hold a Master’s degree in a quantitative field.
Experience working directly in Analytics or Data Science, or have collaborated on E2E projects with colleagues specializing in these topics before
Working knowledge of the statistics behind A/B testing and basic modeling techniques such as linear regression.
Experience designing systems E2E, going from problem statements via ideation to data and metrics in production.
Proven knowledge of Python and Spark
Knowledge of Hadoop, Hive, Oozie, Kafka, Airflow.
Experience with Data Warehousing and ETL/ELT pipelines at scale
Excellent communication skills with both technical and product stakeholders - verbal and written
Experience solving real problems using data mining techniques and with statistical rigor
Strong skills in storytelling with data



Benefits & Perks: Global Impact, Personal Relevance


Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme including: parental (22-weeks paid leave), grandparent, bereavement, and care leave
Hybrid working including flexible working arrangements, working from home furniture and ergonomic support, and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country)
A beautiful sustainable HQ Campus in Amsterdam, that offers on-site meals, coffee, and snacks, multi-faith and breastfeeding rooms at the office
Commuting allowance and bike reimbursement scheme
Discounts & Wallet credits to spend on our products, upgrade to Booking.com Genius Level 3, and friends & family Booking.com discount vouchers
Free access to online learning platforms, development and mentorship programs
Global Employee Assistance Program, free Headspace membership



#ThinkInclusion: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Booking.com

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations. Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just create a unique workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable adjustments to participate in the interview process. Please contact us to request adjustments.

Pre-Employment Screening

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.
Show more
HTML:
About the Team:

We are a key part of the Pricing Foundations team, responsible for optimizing and measuring the dynamics of our two-sided marketplace, impacting both our partners and customers. Our mission is to ensure high-quality supply by carefully analyzing the effects of our pricing products on these stakeholders. Through comprehensive performance measurement, we have become the first OTA (Online Travel Agency) capable of providing partners with personalized insights into how specific pricing products impact their business. Our work involves building a sophisticated data service that manages this process end-to-end—from running experiments and developing machine learning models to estimating the impact on each partner. This data-driven approach ensures that our partners' benefits are closely aligned with the interests of our customers. Our data team has a deep expertise in A/B testing, and strives to measure the impact of incentive offerings, and has strong track record in developing and maintaining data products and mature services. Our team is made up of Data Scientists and Analysts, working closely with engineering and machine learning teams within the track.

Key Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist Analytics Engineer, you will be in charge of the development, performance, quality, and scaling of our data and metrics generating pipelines. You will work closely with a team of Data Scientists and Analysts as well as product.

  • Develop scalable, flexible, and high-performance datasets and metrics by building data pipelines that process large amounts of data and power business critical decision making.
  • Partner with analysts, data scientists and product stakeholders on the data needs for metrics, dashboards, and analytic capabilities that will have the greatest impact on business decisions.
  • Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions through your own work as well as acting as an intermediary for problems and connecting the work of software engineers to analytics stakeholders.
  • End-to-end ownership of data and metrics quality in your team’s datasets and pipelines.
  • Abstract patterns across dashboards and analyses in order to simplify and reuse code and data across the workflows involved. Optimize the analytics workflows to achieve scale and reliability.
  • Help drive the modernization of Booking’s analytics systems, partnering with the data platform teams to leverage and influence the latest technologies. Be a force for keeping data and systems current with the latest technologies.


Years of relevant Job Knowledge.Years of relevant Job Knowledge

  • Broad Job Knowledge (3 - 5 years)


Requirements Of Special Knowledge/skills

  • Professional experience in the broad field of Data Engineering and hold a Master’s degree in a quantitative field.
  • Experience working directly in Analytics or Data Science, or have collaborated on E2E projects with colleagues specializing in these topics before
  • Working knowledge of the statistics behind A/B testing and basic modeling techniques such as linear regression.
  • Experience designing systems E2E, going from problem statements via ideation to data and metrics in production.
  • Proven knowledge of Python and Spark
  • Knowledge of Hadoop, Hive, Oozie, Kafka, Airflow.
  • Experience with Data Warehousing and ETL/ELT pipelines at scale
  • Excellent communication skills with both technical and product stakeholders - verbal and written
  • Experience solving real problems using data mining techniques and with statistical rigor
  • Strong skills in storytelling with data


Benefits & Perks: Global Impact, Personal Relevance

  • Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme including: parental (22-weeks paid leave), grandparent, bereavement, and care leave
  • Hybrid working including flexible working arrangements, working from home furniture and ergonomic support, and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country)
  • A beautiful sustainable HQ Campus in Amsterdam, that offers on-site meals, coffee, and snacks, multi-faith and breastfeeding rooms at the office
  • Commuting allowance and bike reimbursement scheme
  • Discounts & Wallet credits to spend on our products, upgrade to Booking.com Genius Level 3, and friends & family Booking.com discount vouchers
  • Free access to online learning platforms, development and mentorship programs
  • Global Employee Assistance Program, free Headspace membership

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Alleen kom je ver, samen kom je verder. Dat is precies de reden waarom de labels AWI, DDi, Differ Solutions en Infofolio zijn samengekomen in Inpact. Inpact, met de ‘n’ van insurance, want onze vier labels zijn leiders als het over geautomatiseerde verzekeringsprocessen, data en software gaat. We zijn een hechte club van specialisten met een enorme interesse in technologie, AI en Data Science. Met een team van zo’n 100 man sterk blijven we leren, zetten we vol vertrouwen nieuwe stappen en doen we dat op zijn Inpact’s. Een plek waar verandering constant is en waar groei vanzelfsprekend is. Kom erbij als Data Scientist.

DIT IS JOUW UITDAGING

Je komt terecht in een ervaren team op onze vestiging in Veenendaal. Het onderdeel van Inpact waar we bouwen aan modellen die voorspellen. Bijvoorbeeld de inboedelwaarden van alle woningen in Nederland. Of de risico’s van klimaatveranderingen op de verzekeringsmarkt. Complexe puzzels dus, met bergen waardevolle data. Om uiteindelijk zinvolle informatie uit deze data te genereren, ontwikkelen we econometrische modellen zoals ons Hermes- en Iris-model. Doordat de voorspellingskracht van deze modellen erg hoog is zijn wij op dit moment het belangrijkste alternatief voor traditionele waardebepalingen. Mooi toch?

ALS DATA SCIENTIST

Kom je terecht in een compact team met data analisten, engineers en wetenschappers. Samen maken jullie ons platform dé plek waar iedere verzekeraar naar toe gaat om inzicht te krijgen in data en informatieproducten. Als Data Scientist houd je de bestaande modellen kwalitatief op orde en werk je voortdurend aan het verder uitbreiden van het dataplatform. Je bent in staat snel nieuwe kennis op te doen zodat je zelf met nieuwe ideeën en technieken komt en je neemt het team daar graag in mee. Daarnaast ga je aan de slag met: 


Het ontwerpen en bouwen van machine learning-modellen om op de informatiebehoefte van onze klanten in te spelen.
Het zorgdragen dat de in productie genomen modellen voldoen aan het compliance raamwerk
Het adviseren van het Data Science-team over eventuele verbeteringen.



JOUW SPECS


Je hebt een relevante wo-opleiding in de richting Data Science, Informatica, Wiskunde, Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Econometrie.
Minimaal 3+ jaar ervaring als Data Scientist.
Ervaring met Python en source control (Git).
Ervaring met (My)SQL en/of ruimtelijke data is een pré.
Je bent proactief, analytisch, samenwerkingsgericht en communicatief sterk.
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal.



ONZE SPECS


Meteen een vast contract.
Salaris tussen €3.110 en €3.887 per maand.
MS Surface laptop en snelle smartphone.
Continue focus op jouw ontwikkeling.
Betaalde workshops & trainingen.
BBQ’s, LAN-party’s en robot rally’s. ;-)



IMPACT MAKEN BIJ INPACT?

Welkom bij Inpact waar 100 collega’s (waarvan zeker 70 tech-specialisten) samen maximale focus voor verzekeringsprofessionals creëren en faciliteren. De sfeer is open en informeel en de setting uitnodigend. Van overdreven poeha houden we niet en we zijn ook geen fan van onnodig overwerken. Als het licht in ons toffe pand na een werkdag nog brandt, is dat meestal omdat we nog een potje aan het poolen zijn. Wacht niet langer en druk op de sollicitatiebutton!
Show more

De sfeer is open en informeel en de setting uitnodigend. Van overdreven poeha houden we niet en we zijn ook geen fan van onnodig overwerken. Als het licht in ons toffe pand na een werkdag nog brandt, is dat meestal omdat we nog een potje aan het poolen zijn. Wacht niet langer en druk op de sollicitatiebutton!

Title: Data scientist
Description:
Werken met Python aan innovatieve oplossingen die Nederland elke dag weer een stukje beter, veiliger en bereikbaarder maakt? Modellen ontwikkelen in samenwerking met data engineers en data visualisatie experts? Dat is waar data science bij Rijkswaterstaat voor staat! Heb je interesse in deze functie? Lees dan vooral verder!

Hoe jij bijdraagt in jouw rol

Als data scientist werk je in Agile teams. Hier bouw je samen met collega data scientists en engineers aan slimme innovatieve oplossingen voor een veilig, leefbaar en bereikbaar Nederland. Voorspelbaar onderhoud, beeldherkenning en text analytics zijn slechts een paar van de voorbeelden waar je mee in aanraking zult komen. De focus daarbij is gericht op de ontwikkeling van mensgerichte betrouwbare en uitlegbare Artificiële Intelligentie (AI) en het adviseren van klanten over de toepassing daarvan. Werkzaamheden worden uitgevoerd aan de hand van een AI normenkader.

Dit is waar jij voldoening uit haalt

Je krijgt energie van het ontwikkelen van data science oplossingen voor nieuwe producten in jouw Agile team. Met veel enthousiasme werk je aan componenten die bruikbaar zijn voor verschillende projecten. Het zelfstandig oplossen van complexe datavragen geeft je voldoening, vooral omdat jouw werk cruciaal is voor een veiliger Nederland. Jij pakt dan ook met plezier het initiatief voor diverse projecten binnen het vakgebied.

Daarnaast blijf je graag op de hoogte van veranderingen in technische platforms en systemen. Je deelt graag je kennis door middel van pair programming, code reviews, masterclasses en het geven van presentaties over jouw werk of dat van je teamleden. Ook vind je het leuk om studenten en junior data scientists begeleiding te bieden binnen de organisatie.

Wat wij aan jou waarderen

In jouw rol als data scientist ga je ondernemend en analytisch te werk. Je beschikt over een flinke dosis nieuwsgierigheid en je hebt de energie om in een snel tempo veel te leren. Daarnaast ben je ook creatief, een teamspeler en communicatief sterk. Je herkent je in onze kernwaarden: resultaatgericht, aanspreekbaar, dienstverlenend, integer, ondernemend en verbindend.

Dat kunnen wij ons heel goed voorstellen! Bekijk dan alvast de video over de kansen van datagedreven werken bij Rijkswaterstaat en leer hier alles over. Zou je eerst nog wat meer informatie willen over de functie, bel dan gerust met Emanuel Wallden Viklund via 06-21387012, hij staat je graag te woord! En is jouw interesse gewekt? Solliciteer direct!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - LLM
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 4 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with PST time zone

Standard work hours are 8 AM PST - 4 PM PST.

Must-Have


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming.
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.


Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Research Scientist
HTML:
Company Intro


Toloka AI is a global tech company that offers end-to-end data labeling solutions based on the effective combination of public crowd, domain experts and ML. Toloka has one of the most advanced annotation platforms in the market together with huge experience gathered by the whole team. Our solutions are powered by the most diverse global crowd from 100+ countries speaking 40+ languages and extensive experience in the practical application of SOTA models.


Toloka AI Research team strives to enhance the capabilities and safety of frontier models with valuable data, advanced training, and evaluation methods. We collaborate with top institutions on research publications and contribute new high-quality data and post-training methods to open-source.


We are looking for an experienced Research Scientist who will drive innovation and push the boundaries of AI model development, ensuring both cutting-edge performance and safety.


Project examples


  • Evaluate the impact of data on model performance through internal fine-tuning experiments;
  • Develop high-quality evaluation metrics to measure performance in coding, math, reasoning, multimodality, and other complex tasks;
  • Experiment with red-teaming approaches to identify model vulnerabilities and improve safety alignment.


Responsibilities


  • Establish partnerships with other research labs (universities and AI companies);
  • Develop research ideas, design data collection pipelines, and conduct experiments;
  • Publish scientific papers and present at top-tier conferences.


Qualifications


  • Comprehensive knowledge of deep learning fundamentals and a strong scientific understanding of the field of generative AI;
  • PhD or industry research experience in computer science, machine learning, data science, or a related field;
  • Proven track record and experience conducting deep learning research, from idea to publication;
  • Strong engineering skills with proficiency in Python and commonly used ML frameworks/libraries;
  • Proficiency in English (C1+).


Preferred but not required


  • Published papers at top-tier venues (such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, ACL, EMNLP, etc.);
  • Experience with large language models or other generative AI technologies;
  • Industry experience in machine learning, data science, or a related field.


What we can offer


  • Personal and career development: we support employee’s ambition for professional development and encourage them to implement their ideas in their projects;
  • Flexibility: we offer remote or hybrid employment. You will also design with your manager a workday that works best for you;
  • Paid parental leave + Annual vacation policy;
  • Transportation expenses reimbursement;
  • Meal allowance for every working day in the office;
  • Contributions to personal pension plan.

Title: AI/MLops Engineer
Description:
About Us:

At Lensor, we’re at the cutting edge of automotive AI, creating solutions that automate vehicle inspections. As a spin-off from PON, we blend the stability of an established company with the innovation and energy of a start-up. Our young, dynamic team is passionate about developing AI-driven products that make a tangible impact. With a culture that values creativity, diversity, and fun, we’re looking for talented individuals to join us in Amsterdam or remotely as we expand our operations.




Role Overview:

As an AI/ML Ops Engineer at Lensor, you’ll play a crucial role in deploying and managing AI/ML models, optimizing our infrastructure, and ensuring seamless integration across various platforms. This role offers a unique opportunity to work on innovative projects while growing your skills in a dynamic, supportive environment. You'll have the chance to shape the future of our product as we implement our solutions for customers.




What You’ll Do:

Model Deployment and Integration: Design, implement, and maintain scalable machine learning pipelines and deploy models to production with high availability.
Infrastructure and Automation: Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines for ML model deployment and automate testing/validation workflows.
Data Preprocessing and Engineering: Work with large datasets to perform data cleaning, normalization, and transformation, and manage third-party data annotation processes.
Monitoring and Maintenance: Monitor model performance, data drift, and implement robust logging and alerting systems.
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with AI Engineers and developers to streamline ML processes and communicate improvements.
Security and Compliance: Ensure all AI/ML operations comply with data privacy and security regulations.




Who You Are:

Python Proficient: Strong experience in Python and testing frameworks, with a solid foundation in software engineering.
AI/ML Enthusiast: Experience or strong interest in AI/ML technologies, with a desire to contribute to innovative projects.
Collaborative Team Player: You thrive in an international, dynamic environment and enjoy working closely with a diverse team.
Innovative Problem Solver: You’re creative, resourceful, and eager to tackle challenges in a fast-paced start-up.




What We Offer:

Innovation Days: Time to work on your own creative projects and initiatives.
Flexibility: A flexible, supportive work environment that values work-life balance.
Growth Opportunities: Endless opportunities to expand your skills and career in a growing start-up.
Strong Foundation: Stability from being part of PON, while enjoying the agility of a start-up.
Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, excellent pension scheme, and visa sponsorship, including 30% tax ruling support.
Tools & Equipment: MacBook, cell phone, and all necessary tools to excel in your role.
Generous Time Off: 20 vacation days plus an additional individual choice budget for extra leave.
Development Opportunities: Participate in summer and winter labs, training, and courses to enhance your skills.
Pon Fit Program: Access to fitness activities like bootcamps, running events, and more.
Health & Discounts: Collective health insurance discounts and staff discounts on Pon products.




Core Values at Lensor:

Pioneering Spirit: Passion for AI and technology, constantly pushing boundaries.
Customer Focus: Delivering solutions that solve real-world problems.
Innovation: Creativity and risk-taking are at the heart of what we do.
Community: Embracing diversity, fostering collaboration, and supporting each other’s growth.




How to Apply:

Are you as enthusiastic as we are about Lensor? Then we are looking forward to meeting you! Click on apply and upload your Motivation and CV!

Show more
HTML:
About Us:

At Lensor, we’re at the cutting edge of automotive AI, creating solutions that automate vehicle inspections. As a spin-off from PON, we blend the stability of an established company with the innovation and energy of a start-up. Our young, dynamic team is passionate about developing AI-driven products that make a tangible impact. With a culture that values creativity, diversity, and fun, we’re looking for talented individuals to join us in Amsterdam or remotely as we expand our operations.


Role Overview:

As an AI/ML Ops Engineer at Lensor, you’ll play a crucial role in deploying and managing AI/ML models, optimizing our infrastructure, and ensuring seamless integration across various platforms. This role offers a unique opportunity to work on innovative projects while growing your skills in a dynamic, supportive environment. You'll have the chance to shape the future of our product as we implement our solutions for customers.


What You’ll Do:

  • Model Deployment and Integration: Design, implement, and maintain scalable machine learning pipelines and deploy models to production with high availability.
  • Infrastructure and Automation: Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines for ML model deployment and automate testing/validation workflows.
  • Data Preprocessing and Engineering: Work with large datasets to perform data cleaning, normalization, and transformation, and manage third-party data annotation processes.
  • Monitoring and Maintenance: Monitor model performance, data drift, and implement robust logging and alerting systems.
  • Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with AI Engineers and developers to streamline ML processes and communicate improvements.
  • Security and Compliance: Ensure all AI/ML operations comply with data privacy and security regulations.


Who You Are:

  • Python Proficient: Strong experience in Python and testing frameworks, with a solid foundation in software engineering.
  • AI/ML Enthusiast: Experience or strong interest in AI/ML technologies, with a desire to contribute to innovative projects.
  • Collaborative Team Player: You thrive in an international, dynamic environment and enjoy working closely with a diverse team.
  • Innovative Problem Solver: You’re creative, resourceful, and eager to tackle challenges in a fast-paced start-up.


What We Offer:

  • Innovation Days: Time to work on your own creative projects and initiatives.
  • Flexibility: A flexible, supportive work environment that values work-life balance.
  • Growth Opportunities: Endless opportunities to expand your skills and career in a growing start-up.
  • Strong Foundation: Stability from being part of PON, while enjoying the agility of a start-up.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, excellent pension scheme, and visa sponsorship, including 30% tax ruling support.
  • Tools & Equipment: MacBook, cell phone, and all necessary tools to excel in your role.
  • Generous Time Off: 20 vacation days plus an additional individual choice budget for extra leave.
  • Development Opportunities: Participate in summer and winter labs, training, and courses to enhance your skills.
  • Pon Fit Program: Access to fitness activities like bootcamps, running events, and more.
  • Health & Discounts: Collective health insurance discounts and staff discounts on Pon products.


Core Values at Lensor:

  • Pioneering Spirit: Passion for AI and technology, constantly pushing boundaries.
  • Customer Focus: Delivering solutions that solve real-world problems.
  • Innovation: Creativity and risk-taking are at the heart of what we do.
  • Community: Embracing diversity, fostering collaboration, and supporting each other’s growth.


How to Apply:

Are you as enthusiastic as we are about Lensor? Then we are looking forward to meeting you! Click on apply and upload your Motivation and CV!

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Is het jouw persoonlijke missie om bij te dragen aan een eerlijkere en veiligere data-gedreven toekomst voor iedereen?




Heb je het gevoel dat je de (maatschappelijke) impact mist die je met jouw unieke kennis en vaardigheden zou kunnen maken? Het doen van betekenisvol werk? Brush AI biedt een verfrissende uitdaging waar je echt het verschil kan maken. Wij zijn een nieuwe en progressieve responsible AI consultant, één van de eersten in Nederland, met als missie om iedereen van een eerlijke en veilige data-gedreven toekomst te voorzien. Pionier je met ons mee?




Wat doet een AI Engineer?

Als AI Engineer ben je voornamelijk bezig met het ontwerpen, bouwen en beheren van responsible AI-toepassingen voor onze klanten; Je helpt mee van initieel ontwerp, naar een eerste prototype tot een volwassen geïntegreerde AI-toepassing. In het begin werk je voornamelijk zelfstandig, maar je hebt altijd jouw collega's waar je om advies kan vragen. Daarnaast dagen we je uit om mee te denken over de richting waarin Brush AI zich gaat ontwikkelen. Om die redenen willen we dan ook dat je je comfortabel voelt bij het nemen en dragen van veel verantwoordelijkheid, alsmede energie krijgt van het bijdragen aan onze gezamenlijke missie.




Samengevat, als AI Engineer bij Brush AI ben je voornamelijk bezig met;

Het inrichten, opzetten en implementeren van responsible AI-toepassingen
Het onderhouden van contact met de klant, om ze zo goed van (technisch) advies te kunnen voorzien
Op de hoogte blijven van de nieuwste technologische ontwikkelingen op het gebied van Responsible AI
Sparren en samenwerken met Brush AI's partners in Nederland en België




Wat jou de ideale persoon voor deze job maakt

Voldoe je niet volledig aan onderstaande punten, maar triggert het jou wel om te solliciteren? Doe dit dan gerust en overtuig ons waarom jij de juiste persoon voor de job bent!




Tech skills:

Je hebt 3+ jaar ervaring als Data Scientist, Data Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer óf Software Engineer
Je hebt een BSc of MSc in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science of gerelateerd
Je hebt ervaring met programmeren in Python en gerelateerde ML packages (bv. Pyspark, Tensorflow/Keras, pytorch, SKlearn);
Je hebt ervaring met databases, Git en DevOps
Nice to have: ervaring met GenAI, het Microsoft platform (i.e. Azure, AI Studio)




Soft skills:

Je hebt een sterke affiniteit met data ethiek en Responsible AI
Je kan een trekkende rol op je nemen binnen de projecten bij onze klanten, waarbij je soms ook fungeert als primair aanspreekpunt
Je bent in zowel het Nederlands als Engels mondeling en schriftelijk vaardig




Wie is Brush AI?

Brush AI helpt bedrijven om verantwoord te innoveren met Artificial Intelligence (AI). Dit doen we middels het aanbieden van een aantal diensten, zoals bijvoorbeeld:

Het identificeren, inrichten en doorontwikkelen van responsible AI-toepassingen met de mens als uitgangspunt
Het opstellen van AI-governance frameworks waarmee organisaties verantwoord AI kunnen toepassen
Het auditen van algoritmes, op o.a. bias




Wat ons anders maakt dan andere AI-aanbieders is dat wij naast de benodigde technische kennis over AI ook expertise in huis hebben rondom data ethiek. Onze kernwaarden zijn dan ook:




Interpreteerbaarheid & Transparantie: Wij maken algoritmen waarvan we begrijpen hoe ze werken en waarmee je als expert beslissingen kan maken.
Eerlijkheid: Wij maken algoritmen die werken voor iedereen, overal. Niemand hoort gediscrimineerd of buitengesloten te worden door een algoritme.
Veiligheid: Wij maken algoritmen waar je op kunt vertrouwen.




Brush AI heeft kantoorruimte in Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Breda en Kontich (België).

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
My client within the risk management sector in Amsterdam are seeking a generative AI consultant/ responsible AI manager to join their team to work on projects to help make AI more responsible and ethical within the industry!




Responsibilities:




• Design, develop, and optimize generative AI algorithms tailored to address specific banking sector requirements, such as fraud detection, risk assessment etc.

• Train, fine-tune, and validate generative models using state-of-the-art techniques, ensuring robust performance and adherence to regulatory standards and ethical guidelines

• Working on specific projects with multi-national clients, helping solve key business problems for them

• Leading projects and coaching more junior members of the team




Requirements:




• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a relevant field (AI, Computer Science, Maths, Physics etc.)

• Natural Language Processing experience, should have experience/affinity working with Large Language Models

• Knowledge of Tensorflow and Pytorch is ideal but not required

• Experience working with generative AI use cases

• Experience in a client-facing environment is a plus but not required




Salary Package:




• Up to €120,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance.

• Hybrid working (2 days per week from home)

• Annual bonus. (depending on the company performance)

• Flexible hours.




Reach out to me via the following:




Phone: +31203997864

Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

Title: AI Datascientist
HTML:
Wat wij vragen

Opleiding

MBO

Talen

  • Je beheerst Nederlands

Wat wij bieden

Uren

20 uur per week

Vacaturebeschrijving

Opdrachtomschrijving

KVK is op zoek naar interim een AI Data Scientist. Je gaat werken bij de afdeling InnovatieLab. Wij werken helemaal aan het begin van de productcyclus. Wij zorgen voor meer zicht op duidelijke business cases. Dat doen we door validatie van de aannames en we maken de gebruikerswensen helder. Door kort cyclisch oplossingen te toetsen bij klanten, binnen de eigen organisatie en op maakbaarheid, krijgen we inzicht in de haalbaarheid van nieuwe processen, producten en diensten. Het doel is om interesse te creëren in de organisatie die de ideeën, met onze hulp, om kan zetten naar nieuwe producten en diensten.

Wat ga je doen?

KVK InnovatieLab Toetst Deze Aannames Door Werkende Prototypes/proof Of Concepts Te Bouwen Om Daarmee De Maakbaarheid, De Gewenstheid, De Mogelijkheden Voor Strategische Inpassing Aan Te Tonen (of Te Verwerpen). Je Belangrijkste Activiteit

  • Het bouwen van de proto-applicaties in korte sprints;
  • Je codeert en managet de pipeline naar onze POC-omgeving;
  • Je gebruikt open source libraries en bestaande modellen waar mogelijk en maakt die toepasbaar voor KVK;
  • Je documenteert de verantwoording, herleidbaarheid en validatie van de toegepaste modellen en begeleidt de overdracht;
  • Je geeft advies over de te onderzoeken gebieden, de te gebruiken technieken, en de uitvoering van de tests.

Verantwoordelijkheden

  • Vertaalslag maken van kans naar concrete aanpak en opzet van experiment;
  • Realiseren van Proof of concepts/prototype oplossingen op basis van AI services;
  • Functionele story's schrijven;
  • Experimenteren en valideren van proto-oplossingen;
  • Gebruikersonderzoek (mede-)faciliteren.

12 maanden | 20 uur per week | 0,5 fte

Dutch native or near native

  • Afgeronde opleiding op minimaal WO niveau;
  • Opleiding op het gebied van Datascience, Machine learning, Datamodellering, Artificial Intelligence of vergelijkbaar;
  • Actuele kennis van datamodellering: verantwoording, herleidbaarheid en validatie van toe te passen modellen;
  • Actuele (in de afgelopen 5 jaar) en minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met de volgende technieken: Natural language processing; Large Language Models; Machine Learning; Text mining en cluster-analyses, validatie, allen fundamentele kennis; Feature engineering; Model selectie & training; Model Evaluatie & Optimalisatie;
  • Actuele (in de afgelopen 5 jaar) en minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met Programmeertaal Python;
  • Actuele (in de afgelopen 5 jaar) ervaring met het (zelfstandig) werken met CI/CD pipelines, bij voorkeur GitLab CI en containerplatforms, bij voorkeur Docker en Kubernetes;
  • Actuele (in de afgelopen 5 jaar) ervaring met RAG en met open source LLM's;
  • Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met Natural language processing; Computer vision; OCR - allen fundamentele kennis;
  • Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met deze data verrijking: knowledge graphs, ontologien, taxonomieën, data modelling, metadatering, webscaping, data visualisatie (Matplotlib);
  • Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met information retrieval: search, semantic search en linked data;
  • Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met het werken in de (semi-)publieke sector, liefst met oplossingen bij basisregisters;
  • Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met het in productie brengen van AI oplossingen;
  • Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met Relevante Python libraries (bijv. scikit-learn, pandas, spacy, pytorch, openai) en Testframeworks (bijv. pytest), TensorFlow, Keras, NumPy, Flask, Spark;
  • Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB.

Herken jij jezelf in dit profiel? Solliciteer dan direct! We streven ernaar om binnen één werkdag contact met je op te nemen.

 Nu solliciteren

Solliciteer op de website van het uitzendbureau

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Role Description:




The DocumentHandler is an intelligent email processing tool, which improves the routing of our incoming e-mails. By directly routing the e-mails to the correct location, it improves the efficiency and enhances the quality of the e-mail process for our customers.




Project / Your contributions to the DocumentHandler: You will implement the DocumentHandler for one of our business lines, integrating it into a new process. This will require new functionalities for the DocumentHandler, which you will define and develop.




Your profile: -




Effective written and verbal communication skills in Dutch and English - At least 3 years of work experience as a Data Scientist




You are skilled in: -




Must have, experience with

project management

o Stakeholder management

o Excellent communication skills

o Collaboration in a multidisciplinary team

o Translating business needs into technical solutions

o Ability to make complex information understandable and accessible for non-technical stakeholders.




- Must have, high level of proficiency in Python

- Nice to have, experience with:

o Regular expressions

o Azure Document Intelligence

o LLMs.

o Azure Synapse

o Azure DevOps

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
What is the role about?

Bitvavo is actively expanding our Data Science team within the Compliance, Legal and Risk departments. We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist with specific expertise in these areas to join our growing team. This crucial role reinforces Bitvavo's commitment to leveraging data across regulatory and risk frameworks, enhancing our data-driven approach.

As an integral part of the data team, you will play a vital role in shaping the future of cryptocurrency trading. Your responsibilities will include generating analytical insights, building models, developing data products, improving data quality and standards for informed decision-making, and providing stakeholders with the information they need to optimise their operations. A significant focus of your role will be on building models and data products that drive strategic business decisions and operational efficiencies.

How will you make an impact?

Responsibilities

In your capacity as a Data Scientist, you will collaborate with Data Analysts, Analytics Engineers and Data Engineers to empower various business areas with data-driven insights. Your key responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:


Conducting comprehensive data analysis and building predictive models to tackle business challenges, uncover opportunities, and streamline processes in areas such as Risk, Fraud, Financial Crime, Compliance, and Operations
Establishing and nurturing partnerships with stakeholders to promote a culture of data-centric decision-making within Bitvavo
Leading the charge in data analytics and data science projects, from the planning stage through to execution, effectively turning insights into actionable strategies
Collaborating closely with the many product and engineering teams at Bitvavo to enhance data sets and pipelines in order to make Bitvavo more data-driven
Enabling the business by developing and deploying user-friendly self-service analytical tools, making them accessible to non-technical users and promoting widespread data utilization


How will you be successful?


At least 4 years of relevant experience in a Data Scientist/Quantitative Analyst role or similar, preferably with direct involvement in the CLR domain
Academic qualifications in STEM or related disciplines (Data Science, Computer Science or Econometrics)
Expertise in data analytics using scripting languages (SQL), BI tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI)
Solid command of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Tensorflow, Keras) for building predictive models and carrying out more sophisticated analyses
Enthusiasm for contributing to a fast-paced industry within a rapidly expanding company
Ability to simplify complex technical outcomes into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders
Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work across departments and with a wide range of stakeholders, bridging tech, product, and business needs to drive unified solutions


Bitvavo does not accept resumes from staffing, search, or recruitment firms without a signed agreement. If you send us a resume without such an agreement, we may contact the candidate directly without any obligation whatsoever and no fee of any kind will be paid should we hire the candidate.

Benefits

We care about our people. That's why we have a broad range of benefits to support them mentally, physically, and in their career growth. And an extra holiday for your birthday, just for fun.


Flexible well-being budget
Training and development budget
Competitive package
Hybrid working
Pension scheme
26 days holiday leave
Internet allowance
Mental health support platform

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist – Amsterdam

€5,000 - €6,500 Per Month




As a Senior Data Scientist you will work with the team on predicting conversion probabilities for a million customers. You will lead the development and implementation of advanced analytics solutions together with your team.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll:

Build, maintain and automate our statistic models
Developing and operationalizing machine learning solutions
Initiate quality and quantity research to understand our (potential) customers in a better way
Cooperate with marketeers, product owners and other stakeholders to design, to execute and analyze results of research and experiments
Inform and advise stakeholders over realized result and strategy




Main Requirements:

Masters degree in relevant subject and have 3+ years of relevant experience as Data Scientist.
Relevant experience with building and maintaining of statistics models and machine learning algorithms with SQL and Python.
Knowledge of AWS services and tools like Sagemaker and knowledge of Docker.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment, proactive, keen on innovation and a strategic and creative thinker.




About the team:

The team is building an International Analytics hub to provide the right models, tools, tech, and best-practices to help realize our growth ambition. In this hub you will be working together with business representatives to identify value adding business cases for advanced statistical analytics. You will be working on exciting and challenging BI, data & AI projects that create real impact for the lotteries and our beneficiary organizations.

HTML:
Senior Data Scientist – Amsterdam

€5,000 - €6,500 Per Month


As a Senior Data Scientist you will work with the team on predicting conversion probabilities for a million customers. You will lead the development and implementation of advanced analytics solutions together with your team.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll:

  • Build, maintain and automate our statistic models
  • Developing and operationalizing machine learning solutions
  • Initiate quality and quantity research to understand our (potential) customers in a better way
  • Cooperate with marketeers, product owners and other stakeholders to design, to execute and analyze results of research and experiments
  • Inform and advise stakeholders over realized result and strategy


Main Requirements:

  • Masters degree in relevant subject and have 3+ years of relevant experience as Data Scientist.
  • Relevant experience with building and maintaining of statistics models and machine learning algorithms with SQL and Python.
  • Knowledge of AWS services and tools like Sagemaker and knowledge of Docker.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment, proactive, keen on innovation and a strategic and creative thinker.


About the team:

The team is building an International Analytics hub to provide the right models, tools, tech, and best-practices to help realize our growth ambition. In this hub you will be working together with business representatives to identify value adding business cases for advanced statistical analytics. You will be working on exciting and challenging BI, data & AI projects that create real impact for the lotteries and our beneficiary organizations.

Title: AI Engineer - Netherlands
Description:
This is a remote position.

Note: One of our clients is building a new team and hiring 8 AI Engineers globally. This is a 100% remote role. This role does not offer any visa sponsorship.

Job Summary:

As an AI Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing AI models and algorithms that solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to integrate AI solutions into our products. Your role will involve researching the latest AI technologies, building scalable machine learning models, and optimizing algorithms for performance and accuracy.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and deploy AI models and algorithms that address business needs and challenges.
Collaborate with data scientists and software engineers to collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets.
Implement machine learning and deep learning models using frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
Optimize and tune models for performance, accuracy, and scalability.
Integrate AI solutions into production systems, ensuring seamless operation and reliability.
Research and stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and data science.
Develop and maintain documentation for AI models, processes, and best practices.
Participate in code reviews and provide feedback to ensure high-quality code and adherence to best practices.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to AI models and systems in production environments.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure AI solutions align with business goals and objectives.


Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in AI, machine learning, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Experience with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, or Scikit-learn.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, neural networks, natural language processing (NLP), and computer vision.
Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms and tools for AI and machine learning (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work with complex datasets.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Ability to manage multiple projects and deliver results on time.


Preferred Qualifications:


Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, generative models, or advanced neural architectures.
Familiarity with DevOps practices for AI/ML, including CI/CD pipelines and containerization.
Relevant certifications in AI or machine learning.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Coders Connect is excited to partner with a groundbreaking company driving the energy transition in the Netherlands. This innovative organization is harnessing cutting-edge technology to optimize real assets and batteries, creating immediate impact for both customers and society at large. They’re on a mission to build a sustainable future, and we’re helping them find a confident, independent Senior Data Scientist to lead the charge.




What You'll Be Doing:

Leading and growing the Data Science function within the business.
Taking existing algorithms to the next level through innovation and cloud deployment on AWS.
Applying your expertise in Time Series analysis while working hands-on with Python, SQL, and advanced technologies such as Pytorch and Tensorflow.
Implementing data models that deliver actionable insights to drive business value and accelerate societal impact.




Requirements:

5+ years of experience in Data Science, with strong Python and SQL skills.
Expertise in Time Series analysis with a solid mathematical foundation.
Cloud deployment experience using AWS.
An independent, curious problem-solver who thrives on ownership and enjoys implementing innovative models.
While experience in the energy sector is a plus, it’s not a must.




Benefits:

Be at the heart of the energy transition, working on projects that have an immediate and tangible real-world impact.
Shape the future of the Data Science department with the freedom to implement your ideas and make a direct contribution to the company’s growth.
Join a close-knit team, working alongside a CTO, three developers, and a part-time Data Scientist, all committed to advancing technology in this rapidly growing sector.
Hybrid work environment in the vibrant city of Utrecht.
