Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Functie­omschrijving

Vakmanschap staat bij jou voorop. Je past de nieuwste data science technieken toe om voorspellende analyses te ontwikkelen, valideren en realiseren. Iets waar je binnen het CJIB ook volop de ruimte voor krijgt!

Binnen het Innovatielab-team ga je werken aan datagedreven innovaties binnen het CJIB. We breiden uit; kom jij ons team versterken?

Wat ga je doen?

Als Junior Data Scientist werk je mee aan datagedreven innovaties om zo nog slimmer en persoonsgerichter te werken. Jij bent voortdurend bezig- en op zoek naar- de geldigheid en geschiktheid van data. Je onderzoekt welke potentie de data van het CJIB bevat.

Samen met je team ben je verantwoordelijk voor het onderzoeken, ontwikkelen en beschikbaar stellen van technieken, modellen en algoritmes die de operationele processen en maatschappelijke impact van het CJIB breed ondersteunen. Dit doe je volgens de geldende wet- en regelgeving en ethische richtlijnen op een wijze die uitlegbaar en transparant is voor de opdrachtgevers en stakeholders.

Je werkt mee aan creatieve, innovatieve en pragmatische oplossingen voor business vraagstukken. Je doet onderzoek naar nieuwe inzichten en presenteert de waarde en mogelijkheden van deze inzichten voor het CJIB. Gezamenlijk registreren, publiceren en monitoren jullie modellen in de Microsoft Azure ML Cloud omgeving. Tevens ondersteun jij de eindgebruiker bij het in gebruik nemen en optimaal benutten van het model.

Als Junior Data Scientist van het team Innovatielab ben je samen met het team een belangrijke sparringpartner voor stakeholders binnen de Business, IT en Data & Analytics bij geïmplementeerde AI-oplossingen en processen. Je ondersteunt bij monitoring van deze, werkt mee aan advies hierover en kom je gezamenlijk met pragmatische oplossingen welke je gezamenlijk implementeert.

Evert Colmer, Operationeel Manager vertelt. “Je komt te werken in een energiek team met veel kennis waarbij samenwerken als zeer belangrijk wordt ervaren. Het team maakt onder andere machinelearning prototypes om de waarde voor de organisatie aan te tonen. Bij een succesvolle pilot wordt in gezamenlijkheid met de business het prototype naar productie gebracht.”

Functie-eisen

Wat vraagt deze functie van jou?

Het team is volop in ontwikkeling, net als de rest van de organisatie. Dit maakt dat wij een collega zoeken die flexibel, creatief en gedreven is om nieuwe tools eigen te maken. Als er rekenkracht en analytisch denken nodig is, kloppen collega’s al snel bij jou aan voor hulp en advies. Dit komt doordat jij data of uitkomsten daarvan, ook al zijn deze complex, zowel schriftelijk, mondeling als visueel helder over weet te brengen. Je bent initiatiefrijk, ondernemend en doelbewust binnen de kaders van jouw werkzaamheden. Breder werken dan alleen je eigen takenpakket en daarmee écht samenwerken in het team ligt jou goed. Door deze eigenschappen in te zetten garandeer jij resultaten binnen jouw verantwoordelijkheden.

Dat jij voor een rol als deze gepassioneerd en geïnteresseerd bent in recente datagedreven ontwikkelingen en trends is vanzelfsprekend. Daarnaast ben jij een teamspeler die hoge eisen stelt aan het eigen werk en dat van het team. Jij zoekt voortdurend naar mogelijkheden om de kwaliteit te verbeteren en motiveert en coacht anderen om dit ook te doen. Energiek, gedreven, vasthoudend en helder in de communicatie zijn hierbij essentieel.

Om succesvol te zijn in deze functie zien wij daarnaast graag het volgende terug in jouw profiel:


Sterke analytische, creatieve en probleemoplossende vaardigheden, bewezen door een HBO of universitaire opleidingsachtergrond/ wo werk- denkniveau*.
Kennis van predictive modelling, machinelearning technieken, NLP, LLM’s, optimalisatie en in het vertalen van gedetailleerde data-analyse naar innovatieve producten;
Kennis van statistische en machinelearning technieken, programmeren en ontwikkelen in Python en SQL;
Kennis van ontwikkelen in Azure Machine Learning studio en Azure DevOps is een pre.
De voertaal is Nederlands. Daarom vragen we een goede beheersing daarvan in woord en geschrift.
Een (online) assessment kan onderdeel zijn van de procedure.


Arbeids­voorwaarden


Salaris­niveau


schaal 10



Maand­salaris: Min €3404 - Max €5389
Show more

schaal 10

Title: Data Scientist II
Description:
About the Team:

We are a key part of the Pricing Foundations team, responsible for optimizing and measuring the dynamics of our two-sided marketplace, impacting both our partners and customers. Our mission is to ensure high-quality supply by carefully analyzing the effects of our pricing products on these stakeholders. Through comprehensive performance measurement, we have become the first OTA (Online Travel Agency) capable of providing partners with personalized insights into how specific pricing products impact their business. Our work involves building a sophisticated data service that manages this process end-to-end—from running experiments and developing machine learning models to estimating the impact on each partner. This data-driven approach ensures that our partners' benefits are closely aligned with the interests of our customers. Our data team has a deep expertise in A/B testing, and strives to measure the impact of incentive offerings, and has strong track record in developing and maintaining data products and mature services. Our team is made up of Data Scientists and Analysts, working closely with engineering and machine learning teams within the track.

Key Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist Analytics Engineer, you will be in charge of the development, performance, quality, and scaling of our data and metrics generating pipelines. You will work closely with a team of Data Scientists and Analysts as well as product.


Develop scalable, flexible, and high-performance datasets and metrics by building data pipelines that process large amounts of data and power business critical decision making.
Partner with analysts, data scientists and product stakeholders on the data needs for metrics, dashboards, and analytic capabilities that will have the greatest impact on business decisions.
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions through your own work as well as acting as an intermediary for problems and connecting the work of software engineers to analytics stakeholders.
End-to-end ownership of data and metrics quality in your team’s datasets and pipelines.
Abstract patterns across dashboards and analyses in order to simplify and reuse code and data across the workflows involved. Optimize the analytics workflows to achieve scale and reliability.
Help drive the modernization of Booking’s analytics systems, partnering with the data platform teams to leverage and influence the latest technologies. Be a force for keeping data and systems current with the latest technologies.



Years of relevant Job Knowledge.Years of relevant Job Knowledge


Broad Job Knowledge (3 - 5 years)



Requirements Of Special Knowledge/skills


Professional experience in the broad field of Data Engineering and hold a Master’s degree in a quantitative field.
Experience working directly in Analytics or Data Science, or have collaborated on E2E projects with colleagues specializing in these topics before
Working knowledge of the statistics behind A/B testing and basic modeling techniques such as linear regression.
Experience designing systems E2E, going from problem statements via ideation to data and metrics in production.
Proven knowledge of Python and Spark
Knowledge of Hadoop, Hive, Oozie, Kafka, Airflow.
Experience with Data Warehousing and ETL/ELT pipelines at scale
Excellent communication skills with both technical and product stakeholders - verbal and written
Experience solving real problems using data mining techniques and with statistical rigor
Strong skills in storytelling with data



Benefits & Perks: Global Impact, Personal Relevance


Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme including: parental (22-weeks paid leave), grandparent, bereavement, and care leave
Hybrid working including flexible working arrangements, working from home furniture and ergonomic support, and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country)
A beautiful sustainable HQ Campus in Amsterdam, that offers on-site meals, coffee, and snacks, multi-faith and breastfeeding rooms at the office
Commuting allowance and bike reimbursement scheme
Discounts & Wallet credits to spend on our products, upgrade to Booking.com Genius Level 3, and friends & family Booking.com discount vouchers
Free access to online learning platforms, development and mentorship programs
Global Employee Assistance Program, free Headspace membership



#ThinkInclusion: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Booking.com

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations. Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just create a unique workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable adjustments to participate in the interview process. Please contact us to request adjustments.

Pre-Employment Screening

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Alleen kom je ver, samen kom je verder. Dat is precies de reden waarom de labels AWI, DDi, Differ Solutions en Infofolio zijn samengekomen in Inpact. Inpact, met de ‘n’ van insurance, want onze vier labels zijn leiders als het over geautomatiseerde verzekeringsprocessen, data en software gaat. We zijn een hechte club van specialisten met een enorme interesse in technologie, AI en Data Science. Met een team van zo’n 100 man sterk blijven we leren, zetten we vol vertrouwen nieuwe stappen en doen we dat op zijn Inpact’s. Een plek waar verandering constant is en waar groei vanzelfsprekend is. Kom erbij als Data Scientist.

DIT IS JOUW UITDAGING

Je komt terecht in een ervaren team op onze vestiging in Veenendaal. Het onderdeel van Inpact waar we bouwen aan modellen die voorspellen. Bijvoorbeeld de inboedelwaarden van alle woningen in Nederland. Of de risico’s van klimaatveranderingen op de verzekeringsmarkt. Complexe puzzels dus, met bergen waardevolle data. Om uiteindelijk zinvolle informatie uit deze data te genereren, ontwikkelen we econometrische modellen zoals ons Hermes- en Iris-model. Doordat de voorspellingskracht van deze modellen erg hoog is zijn wij op dit moment het belangrijkste alternatief voor traditionele waardebepalingen. Mooi toch?

ALS DATA SCIENTIST

Kom je terecht in een compact team met data analisten, engineers en wetenschappers. Samen maken jullie ons platform dé plek waar iedere verzekeraar naar toe gaat om inzicht te krijgen in data en informatieproducten. Als Data Scientist houd je de bestaande modellen kwalitatief op orde en werk je voortdurend aan het verder uitbreiden van het dataplatform. Je bent in staat snel nieuwe kennis op te doen zodat je zelf met nieuwe ideeën en technieken komt en je neemt het team daar graag in mee. Daarnaast ga je aan de slag met: 


Het ontwerpen en bouwen van machine learning-modellen om op de informatiebehoefte van onze klanten in te spelen.
Het zorgdragen dat de in productie genomen modellen voldoen aan het compliance raamwerk
Het adviseren van het Data Science-team over eventuele verbeteringen.



JOUW SPECS


Je hebt een relevante wo-opleiding in de richting Data Science, Informatica, Wiskunde, Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Econometrie.
Minimaal 3+ jaar ervaring als Data Scientist.
Ervaring met Python en source control (Git).
Ervaring met (My)SQL en/of ruimtelijke data is een pré.
Je bent proactief, analytisch, samenwerkingsgericht en communicatief sterk.
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal.



ONZE SPECS


Meteen een vast contract.
Salaris tussen €3.110 en €3.887 per maand.
MS Surface laptop en snelle smartphone.
Continue focus op jouw ontwikkeling.
Betaalde workshops & trainingen.
BBQ’s, LAN-party’s en robot rally’s. ;-)



IMPACT MAKEN BIJ INPACT?

Welkom bij Inpact waar 100 collega’s (waarvan zeker 70 tech-specialisten) samen maximale focus voor verzekeringsprofessionals creëren en faciliteren. De sfeer is open en informeel en de setting uitnodigend. Van overdreven poeha houden we niet en we zijn ook geen fan van onnodig overwerken. Als het licht in ons toffe pand na een werkdag nog brandt, is dat meestal omdat we nog een potje aan het poolen zijn. Wacht niet langer en druk op de sollicitatiebutton!
Show more
HTML:
Alleen kom je ver, samen kom je verder. Dat is precies de reden waarom de labels AWI, DDi, Differ Solutions en Infofolio zijn samengekomen in Inpact. Inpact, met de ‘n’ van insurance, want onze vier labels zijn leiders als het over geautomatiseerde verzekeringsprocessen, data en software gaat. We zijn een hechte club van specialisten met een enorme interesse in technologie, AI en Data Science. Met een team van zo’n 100 man sterk blijven we leren, zetten we vol vertrouwen nieuwe stappen en doen we dat op zijn Inpact’s. Een plek waar verandering constant is en waar groei vanzelfsprekend is. Kom erbij als Data Scientist.

DIT IS JOUW UITDAGING

Je komt terecht in een ervaren team op onze vestiging in Veenendaal. Het onderdeel van Inpact waar we bouwen aan modellen die voorspellen. Bijvoorbeeld de inboedelwaarden van alle woningen in Nederland. Of de risico’s van klimaatveranderingen op de verzekeringsmarkt. Complexe puzzels dus, met bergen waardevolle data. Om uiteindelijk zinvolle informatie uit deze data te genereren, ontwikkelen we econometrische modellen zoals ons Hermes- en Iris-model. Doordat de voorspellingskracht van deze modellen erg hoog is zijn wij op dit moment het belangrijkste alternatief voor traditionele waardebepalingen. Mooi toch?

ALS DATA SCIENTIST

Kom je terecht in een compact team met data analisten, engineers en wetenschappers. Samen maken jullie ons platform dé plek waar iedere verzekeraar naar toe gaat om inzicht te krijgen in data en informatieproducten. Als Data Scientist houd je de bestaande modellen kwalitatief op orde en werk je voortdurend aan het verder uitbreiden van het dataplatform. Je bent in staat snel nieuwe kennis op te doen zodat je zelf met nieuwe ideeën en technieken komt en je neemt het team daar graag in mee. Daarnaast ga je aan de slag met: 

  • Het ontwerpen en bouwen van machine learning-modellen om op de informatiebehoefte van onze klanten in te spelen.
  • Het zorgdragen dat de in productie genomen modellen voldoen aan het compliance raamwerk
  • Het adviseren van het Data Science-team over eventuele verbeteringen.


JOUW SPECS

  • Je hebt een relevante wo-opleiding in de richting Data Science, Informatica, Wiskunde, Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Econometrie.
  • Minimaal 3+ jaar ervaring als Data Scientist.
  • Ervaring met Python en source control (Git).
  • Ervaring met (My)SQL en/of ruimtelijke data is een pré.
  • Je bent proactief, analytisch, samenwerkingsgericht en communicatief sterk.
  • Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal.


ONZE SPECS

  • Meteen een vast contract.
  • Salaris tussen €3.110 en €3.887 per maand.
  • MS Surface laptop en snelle smartphone.
  • Continue focus op jouw ontwikkeling.
  • Betaalde workshops & trainingen.
  • BBQ’s, LAN-party’s en robot rally’s. ;-)


IMPACT MAKEN BIJ INPACT?

Welkom bij Inpact waar 100 collega’s (waarvan zeker 70 tech-specialisten) samen maximale focus voor verzekeringsprofessionals creëren en faciliteren. De sfeer is open en informeel en de setting uitnodigend. Van overdreven poeha houden we niet en we zijn ook geen fan van onnodig overwerken. Als het licht in ons toffe pand na een werkdag nog brandt, is dat meestal omdat we nog een potje aan het poolen zijn. Wacht niet langer en druk op de sollicitatiebutton!

Title: Junior Data Scientist
HTML:
The data science team, operating under the Data & Operations department, is responsible for providing scores and insights derived from one of the largest B2B databases in the world. This department receives requests from both internal and external customers to create models and generate insights that enhance process automation and efficiency, improve decision making and support reporting purposes.

As a junior data scientist your role involves advising our clients on the potential of our data and models, as well as developing custom solutions when necessary. Additionally, you will be involved in building and maintaining our standard and custom solutions, primarily focusing on our credit and sales & marketing scores.

The data science department is continuously developing to ensure our standard credit score to be the best in the market. The candidate for this position should be constantly seeking new and innovative ways to improve upon our existing modeling methodologies. Additionally, our data science department works in close cooperation with the Marketing & Communication team and experts from various departments to create comprehensive market studies and trend reports. These reports are regularly updated to reflect the latest market conditions and are distributed through various channels, including our website, email newsletters, and social media platforms, maximizing their reach and impact. These researched reports serve multiple purposes.

Responsibilities

  • Identify, analyze and interpret relevant trends and patterns within one of the largest B2B databases;
  • Develop, monitor, and recalibrate standard and custom client scores (credit & marketing) to maintain and improve accuracy;
  • Present complex data insights and analytical findings to internal and external stakeholders;
  • Write detailed technical specifications for our ML implementation department, ensuring smooth integration of new models and features;
  • Support the sales team by explaining our data analytical products to potential clients, highlighting their value and competitive advantages;
  • Conduct and assist in market research to identify new opportunities and emerging trends;
  • Develop and implement new indicators and metrics in the B2B market, enhancing our product offerings and analytical capabilities;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data quality, consistency, and compliance with data protection regulations;
  • Contribute to the development of best practices and standard operating procedures for data analysis and model development.


What do we expect from you?

  • A bachelor’s or master’s degree, preferably in a field such with strong focus on statistics, mathematics or computer Science or a related discipline;
  • Proficiency in at least one programming language, preferably Python, R, SAS or SQL;
  • Hands-on experience applying machine learning and statistical models (e.g. neural networks, logistic regression, random forest) is a pre;
  • Knowledge of business and financial concepts and principles is a plus.
  • Speaking Dutch (from B2 level)


What Altares - Dun & Bradstreet has to offer you:

In addition to a pleasant working atmosphere, a good work-life balance and an educational and dynamic working environment, we also offer you:

  • The largest B2B database;
  • The ability to make an impact with data science: freedom and creativity in exploiting the data and the data science techniques to enhance our offering to the market and provide a unique, data science driven customer experience;
  • A competitive salary with attractive secondary employment conditions;
  • Hybrid working: partly at the office, partly from home;
  • An innovative working environment in a data-driven company;
  • A modern office in an iconic location in the heart of Rotterdam;
  • Access to a gym, swimming pool and sauna;
  • Access to LinkedIn Learning & internal training


And finally! We have a “party committee” Fun & Bradstreet that regularly organizes drinks, sporting events and other fun team outings.

Are you interested in the position of Junior Data Scientist? Please apply as soon as possible and we may be in touch soon!

If you have a question about this vacancy, let us know!

Altares Dun & Bradstreet does not accept unsolicited resumes from external recruiters.

Title: Python Data Scientist/Analyst - LLM Project
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 2 - 15 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Payout: USD 15-21 $ per hour

Work timings which is:-primarily, overlap is required from 8 AM to 1 PM PST. The remaining 3 hours can be accommodated either before 8 AM PST or after 1 PM PST

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 6 months

Must-Have

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)

At least 2 years of relevant experience as a data scientist

2+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence

2+ years of experience working with Python programming.

Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 2 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
2+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
2+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Dit ga je doen

Weet jij hoe je een AI/ML-model efficiënt en snel kan draaien met miljoenen regels data en kan jij de API-snelheid verhogen zodat de eindgebruiker snel resultaten ontvangt? Weet jij pyspark/python en SQL optimaal te gebruiken en hoe je een script onderhoudsvriendelijk en productiewaardig maken? Dan zoek we jou om ons datateam te versterken! Als ML Engineer ben je onderdeel van het Data Analytics-team voor Kruidvat (Nederland en België) en Trekpleister. Jij bent de expert op het gebied van MLOps en werkt met talen als pyspark, SQL en natuurlijk python. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het productiewaardig maken van de AI/ML-oplossingen. Daarmee vorm je de brug tussen de Data Scientists en de technologie (Azure/Databricks). Samen met je collega’s uit het team (data scientists, consultants, analisten en engineers) werk je aan uiteenlopende projecten op het gebied van forecasting, logistieke planning, assortiment optimalisatie, e-commerce en CRM.

Als grootste Health & Beauty retailer in de Benelux hebben we een schat aan data die we kunnen gebruiken. Elke week worden we bezocht door meer dan vier miljoen klanten in onze ruim 1500 winkels en webshops. Ruim de helft van onze klanten is lid van de Kruidvat Club waardoor we onze klant steeds beter leren kennen.

Wat doe je zoal als ML Engineer in de dagelijkse praktijk?


Je ontwikkelt samen met Data Science robuuste AI/ML-modellen met goede monitoring op proces-, data- en modelkwaliteit om bugs en verkeerde voorspellingen te voorkomen.
Je adviseert en komt met oplossing voor technische uitdagingen waar je tijdens het ontwikkelproces tegenaan loopt. Denk hierbij aan het verbeteren van de API snelheid of andere trage processtappen in de modelflow.
Je bent een expert in MLOps en CI/CD, onderhoudt de (ML-)modellen en neem initiatief om deze continu te blijven verbeteren.
Je vormt de brug tussen Data Science en Global IT als het gaat om het gebruik van de technologieën (Databricks/Azure), die worden beheerd door Global IT.
Je denkt mee en draagt actief bij aan de ontwikkeling van onze technologie en tooling d.m.v. het ontwikkelen van bijvoorbeeld utility packages of het verder ontwikkelen van onze MLOps-methodiek.
Je blijft mee-ontwikkelen op de innovaties binnen het vakgebied en stelt vast hoe we hiermee invulling kunnen geven aan onze ambities.


Als organisatie investeren we fors in het neerzetten van een state-of-the-art analytics landschap. Als ML Engineer word jij binnen AS Watson Benelux (o.a. Kruidvat, Trekpleister) gezien als expert en dé aangewezen persoon om naar toe te gaan met vragen over Machine Learning (MLops) en andere Cloud-oplossingen. 

Dit krijg je ervoor terug

Een snelle omgeving waarin je veel kunt leren. En werkplezier door verantwoordelijkheid, vrijheid en de ruimte om jezelf te ontplooien. Maar er is meer...  


Best belangrijk: een goed salaris! Afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en opleiding start je tussen de € 4.300,- en € 6.500,- bruto per maand bij een 40-urige werkweek. Plus personeelskorting bij Kruidvat, Trekpleister en ICI PARIS XL! 
24 vakantiedagen en een aantrekkelijke ATV-regeling met 19,5 dagen op fulltime basis. Liever meer vrije tijd of extra geld? Koop of verkoop vakantiedagen of laat je ATV (deels) uitbetalen. 
Volop ontwikkelings- en doorgroeimogelijkheden met onze eigen AS Watson Academy. Bij AS Watson sta je nooit stil.
Goede thuiswerkmogelijkheden. Hybride werken is bij ons heel gewoon en gaat altijd in goed overleg.


Dit ben jij


Je hebt een afgeronde opleiding op WO-niveau. Je hebt een MSc in bijvoorbeeld Computer Science, AI, Data Science.
Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als ML Engineer of als Data Scientist. Je hebt expertise (must) in de programmeertalen Python, PySpark en SQL.
Je hebt kennis van Cloud-oplossingen, bij voorkeur Databricks en Azure.
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met het in productie zetten, onderhouden en monitoren van AI/ML-oplossingen en de MLOps en CI/CD cyclus. Werken met Git is business as usual. Werken met Scrum en Jira is je bekend.
Je bent in staat om met overtuiging je (technische) werk en de uitkomsten helder uit te leggen aan je collega’s. Verder vind je het leuk om met je collega’s te sparren over mogelijke oplossingen en mee te helpen aan de verdere professionalisering van onze afdeling.
Je vindt het leuk om te schakelen tussen business oplossingen met de datacollega’s en de technologie met de IT-collega’s.
Omdat je internationale contacten hebt, beheers je naast het Nederlands ook het Engels goed in woord en geschrift.


Bureaus: leg de telefoon maar weer neer, we doen het zelf.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Description:
We're currently working with a huge global R&D company in Amsterdam, and we're searching for a passionate Senior Researcher to join our cutting-edge team working on AI and speech synthesis.




They are offering either permanent opportunities (for EU Citizens) or 12 month renewable contracts with opportunity for extension (with VISA sponsorship).




Responsibilities include

Teaching emotions in speech: Developing ground-breaking algorithms that will accurately recognize emotions from spoken language.
Expressive speech: Design intriguing models that create natural sounding, emotionally rich text-to-speech synthesis.
See research projects come into reality: Collaborate with other brilliant engineers like yourself to integrate these technologies into real-world applications
Staying at the forefront: Be a lifelong learner, keeping up with the latest technology in AI, machine learning, and affective computing.




Qualifications

Master's or PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
5+ years of experience with text-to-speech algorithms, speech processing, machine learning, and related areas.
Experience analysing and interpreting multimodal data (speech, facial expressions, etc.).




Bonus points if you have:

Experience with natural language processing (NLP) and signal processing.
A passion for pushing the boundaries of AI and its potential impact.




We offer a great referral scheme! If you know someone who you may think will fit this role we offer a great referral pay-scheme :)




Keywords: TTS, Speech Processing, Speech Synthesis, Machine Learning, AI, Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Speech Recognition, Algorithm Development, NLP, Signal Processing

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you obsessed with data and enjoy solving complex puzzles? As a Data Scientist you work on different data science and machine learning challenges, for example forecasting our demand, improving our last mile delivery, or generating better recommendations for our customers. You are part of a fast-growing company with positive impact.




What you'll do

As a Data Scientist you are responsible for many different analyses from both operational and customer perspective. As part of our Analytics team, you will work in an extremely data-rich environment in collaboration with managers from different teams including Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), Warehouse Operations, Product, Growth and Assortment.




You structure, analyse, and model data to translate it into insights. You look for new opportunities for growth, analyse the impact of such initiatives and make that information widely available where necessary. You support colleagues to work more data-driven.




You work on machine learning challenges, such as our demand forecasting model and tools to integrate them in our processes. In doing so, you’ll experiment with using new data and algorithms to improve forecast accuracy. After your experiments, you’ll release new version of your predictive models to production. Our data stack includes BigQuery, PostgreSQL, dbt, Polars, Airflow and Kubernetes, but we’re always open to adopting new technologies.

You get enthusiastic of learning and you like to think in terms of opportunities and possibilities. At Crisp you therefore get plenty of room to develop: in breadth and in depth.




What you'll bring

We are looking for an experienced data scientist who is able to transmit their expertise to our team. At the same time, we hope you’re eager to keep learning in this rapidly evolving field. As our ideal candidate, you’ll meet these requirements:

You have at least 5 years of professional experience as a data scientist, ideally in an (online) retail or e-commerce environment.
You have a master’s degree in a STEM (bèta) field.
You have technical expertise in the field of Machine Learning.
You’re an expert in statistical analyses and data science techniques, including hypothesis testing, regression and classification.
Your mindset is one of growth, learning and possibility.
You’re a good communicator. You are able to explain your models in clear language to business stakeholders from different disciplines.
You're fluent in Dutch and English (written and spoken).




What we offer

Working at a B-Corp certified company where you have the opportunity to make your mark on our food system and drive real change.
Enthusiastic and enterprising colleagues to work and learn with.
Plenty of opportunity to take responsibility from day one.
A look behind the scenes of one of the fastest developing companies in the European market.
A great pension through BPFL.
For now a personal budget for yoga, sports, mobility and downtime via ClassPass, Swapfiets and Blendle and many, many more.
Food for thought with monthly workshops and talks at Crisp University.
Time to get to know your colleagues during sports, events and tastings.
Amazing lunch, drinks and the more-than-occasional home-baked cake every day of the week.
And... a sweet discount on your Crisp groceries, because you'll likely also want to eat well at home.




Interested?

We would love to hear from you! Apply via the button below. The more you can share about yourself and the reason you are applying, the better.




At Crisp, we strive for an inclusive and diverse work environment where everyone is welcome, regardless of their background, gender, age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, or ability. We encourage applicants with diverse perspectives and backgrounds to apply and believe in equal opportunities for all. We value the unique contributions each employee can bring and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone is respected and appreciated.

Show more

Title: Fullstack Engineer - Python, ReactJS - Data platform for Sustainability - Greenfield product - High salary and permanent contract - Amsterdam
Description:
If you care about a sustainability impactful product and great diversity in your team, then check this out:




This is a data driven insights platform to improve sustainability across popular products around the world. Your impact on sustainability is on a global scale! This platform is used by the biggest brands globally. This makes your work very tangible and you can show your friends and family how you contribute to a better world.




With a team of 50 like-minded people you will be building this data platform. The team is diverse and the collaboration is based on trust in an informal setting. The company is very well funded and financially healthy with investments for multiple years. Because the company is in a start-up phase, we are looking for engineers who like to take ownership. You like to take the lead on your projects and you are free to make as many mistakes to learn fast and eventually make an impact.




Most of your work is greenfield! As a fullstack engineer you will have end-2-end responsibilities from architecture, coding, testing and implementation. You will be working closely with data engineers, product specialists and other fullstack engineers. Your backend activities are focus on solid API’s, ready for huge volumes of data. Your frontend activities are to visualize this data is dashboards, diagrams, charts, etc.




You will be working in a modern environment where you will be picking up new technologies.

Their current tech stack is:

Python, FastAPI
Typescript, React]
GCP, BigQuery




The offer is above market standard: a competitive salary between 80k-100k with a permanent contract and good benefits. The working model is hybrid with 2-3 days in the office in Amsterdam (easily accessible with public transport).




You will be encouraged to constantly improve yourself with studies and knowledge sharing events like Women in Tech events.




Interested to hear more? In a call we will go through the details of the job and your background.

The interview process has 2 technical stages and a final interview with their CEO (she will give you great insights into the long term impact of this product).




Looking forward to hearing from you.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
European Patent Examiner




Duration of contract: Five years, renewable (full-time)

Location: Netherlands (The Hague)

Application deadline: 03.11.2024




Curious about future innovation?

Imagine finding yourself every single day exploring breakthrough developments before almost anyone else. As a patent examiner, you have the chance to support the inventors who will shape our world and the lives of millions of people for years to come.




Supporting innovation, competitiveness, sustainability and economic growth: that's our mission at the European Patent Office (EPO)

As the patent office for Europe, we are proud to deliver high-quality services that promote a safer, smarter and more sustainable world, aligned with the UN Sustainable Development Goals and the highest ESG standards. As an equal opportunities employer, the EPO is shaped by the diversity of our people's personalities, knowledge and cultures. Interested in joining us?




What's in it for you

Exclusive access to innovation: gain unique insights into the latest inventions before they reach the market

Inspiring work environment: work with multilingual people from a wide variety of cultures and backgrounds

Job with a purpose: contribute with your insights to the future of technology

Professional growth: access our comprehensive training portfolio and explore opportunities to realise your full potential

Workplace flexibility: benefit from our working arrangements, generous leave policies and a family-friendly work environment




What you will do as a patent examiner

Perform end-to-end examination – in our three official languages – of patent applications, i.e. the texts and drawings that describe an invention for which an individual or a company seeks legal protection
Research, find and use the most relevant prior art, ensuring a comprehensive evaluation of the invention's novelty and inventive step
Support the entire innovation ecosystem by making well-reasoned decisions on whether a patent is to be granted, applying both your technical knowledge and understanding of legal frameworks
Communicate with inventors, patent attorneys and other stakeholders, providing clear and precise explanations of your decisions
Ensure the uniform and effective application of the European Patent Convention and other legal texts, contributing to the robustness of Europe's intellectual property system




What we are looking for

We are currently seeking scientists, engineers and IT, technical, mechanical and material experts who share our passion for innovation and wish to work at the cutting edge of technology, analysing the latest inventions, particularly in the technical areas of:




AI & Quantum Computing: Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning and Quantum Computing




-------------------------------------------------------------------------




Apply if you have

a relevant technical background: you have the expertise required for the areas specified from your studies, projects and concrete work experience

analytical-thinking and decision-making skills: you excel at breaking down complex problems and making informed decisions with confidence and clarity based on thorough research and analysis

curiosity and an eagerness to learn: you enjoy solving technical puzzles and are always keen to learn; you have a thirst for knowledge and staying abreast of the latest developments in your field and beyond and are eager to acquire new skills and pick up technologies in different fields

clear communication skills: you are able to explain things clearly and feel comfortable interacting with colleagues and applicants to process patent applications efficiently




... Sound like you?




By the way, no previous IP knowledge is needed: we take care of that side of things via our dedicated legal training.




Minimum requirements

Master's degree (or equivalent/higher) covering one or more technical fields mentioned above
Excellent knowledge (at least C1) of one of our official languages (English, French and German) and the ability to understand the other two; alternatively, excellent knowledge (at least C1) of English (in such cases, the willingness to learn the missing languages and to reach level B2 within a set time frame would be required)
Work experience in industry would be an advantage
Citizenship of one of the member states of the European Patent Organisation




What we offer at the EPO

A competitive salary
Family-friendly benefits
Generous flexibility options allowing you to work from anywhere in the country of employment (min. on-site attendance applies) and up to 60 days from any EPC contracting state
Relocation benefits and various allowances (e.g. household, dependants, childcare, education, expatriation, installation, rent allowance)
Contributory medical insurance and pension schemes
30+ days of leave per year and flexible working hours
Free gym access
Social activities and clubs
Full list of benefits




Start making a difference. Simply click Apply.




Application and selection process

Visit our Jobs & careers web-page to learn how best to prepare your application and read more about our recruitment process.




The successful candidate will be selected on the basis of qualifications, competencies, professional experience and language knowledge, supplemented as appropriate by technical assessments, interviews and/or a personality questionnaire.




We are currently recruiting for future opportunities starting in 2025 and building our talent pipeline for future growth. Apply now to secure your place on our team and be part of our journey from the very beginning.




A talent pool (reserve list) will be constituted should more candidates than required at this time be considered suitable following the selection procedure. Such talent pools are valid for a period of 24 months and talent‑pool candidates may be contacted should a vacancy with substantially the same profile arise during that period.




-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Key information

Job group: 4

Grade: G7 to G10 (net (basic) monthly salary* for this vacancy: EUR 6 750 to 9 620, depending on experience and location)

Career path: Technical

Working mode: Hybrid

Technical interviews planned for: October 2024 – January 2025

Final interviews planned for: November 2024 – February 2025




*After deduction of EPO-internal tax (no other national income tax applies) and before deduction of staff contributions to the social security and pension schemes.

Title: Python Developer
Company: SEITA - Open software for energy flexibility
Description:
We are looking for a mid/senior software engineer (fully remote) to help us launch a cutting-edge cleantech solution. Keywords: Python, time series, web apps, async, HomeAssistant, optimization/planning, forecasting.

Energy background is an advantage, but you can also grow here into this new field and learn cool open technologies.




Company




We are an open-source software startup in The Netherlands, working on CO2-reducing cloud software. Check https://www.lfenergy.org/projects/flexmeasures/ to see our platform and its code. Our mission is to speed up the energy transition with smart software, across sectors and the world, as fast as possible: https://seita.nl/why/




Seita is founded by software engineers. You will learn with and from us. You will contribute code to open source projects, and also interact with the open source world, e.g. this is a recent presentation at the FOSDEM 2024 conference: https://fosdem.org/2024/schedule/event/fosdem-2024-2509-using-flexmeasures-to-build-a-climate-tech-startup-in-15-minutes/




Please apply until October, 13.




As a bootstrapping startup, our budget is currently limited, so we expect that at this stage we can best cooperate with software developers from non-Western countries. Our team already spans three continents :) We compensate according to skill level and also local conditions like GDP.

Sadly, we cannot sponsor visas at this time.




Role Description




This is a full-time Software Engineer role and fully remote.




You will work with us on the APIs and logic of our energy management solution. This requires development in Flask and on relational databases. Time series are our daily bread. Take a look at our Github to see how we interact on pull requests (https://github.com/FlexMeasures/, https://github.com/SeitaBV/)
We will implement a building energy management system in of our ongoing projects, where you will help develop features in both FlexMeasures (cloud) and the local solution (in the HomeAssistant environment, also an open source project) and async programming. You can also learn about an innovative energy flexibility standard (https://s2standard.org/)
We want to involve you in joint design and requirements sessions with partners, so the best innovation path is found. We want your help in documenting this journey.




Qualifications




In general, we expect a Masters-degree level of education in a relevant field. However, Bachelor's education can be possible, as we've seen very good candidates shine through their relevant and demonstrable work experience. Programming is definitely a craft, not just algorithms.




Strong experience in Python - programming real-world, dependable software is a key task
Good knowledge of Linux OS and command line tools
Experience with time series data (also Pandas)
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Analytical thinking
Bonus: Knowledge / experience with energy applications
Bonus: Experience in optimization, we use linear programming (Pyomo, HiGHS)




Interview process




Please let us know about your motivation to join us (and feel also free to ask questions about the position). We are interested how the first five points in the qualifications list above have been relevant in your career so far.




We will have an informal conversation with interesting candidates, and a small and respectful assignment as second step.

Title: Python Quant Developer / ML Engineer - Global Trading Firm
Description:
Looking to apply your machine learning expertise to cutting-edge trading strategies?




A brand new quant trading pod is being formed at a well-established proprietary trading firm, with an opening for a Python Quant Developer / Machine Learning Engineer to join the team.




You'll be developing machine learning models and algorithms that drive trading strategies with the pod's asset class, which has yet to be decided.




The team is being led by an experienced portfolio manager recently poached from one of the top firms in the industry. You’ll have the opportunity to work closely with him to help establish the pod and directly contribute to building its PnL from the ground up.




You'll collaborate closely with quants and engineers in a start-up like culture, to build and refine machine learning models that improve trading decisions.




You’ll need strong Python skills, experience with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch, a solid background in data analysis and statistics, and ideally experience with financial markets.




With a bonus pool tied to the PnL of the strategies you help develop, compensation is not barriered, rewarding those who directly contribute to the firm's success.




Location is in Amsterdam, but relocation is on the cards for the right candidate.




Looking to join the leaders in Quant Trading? Please apply or contact me directly at megan@saragossa.io




No up-to-date CV required.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
The energy transition needs you as a Python developer

As a Medior/Senior Python Back-end Developer, you will play a pivotal role in the department System Operations, contributing to the development and management of applications and APIs that handle vast amounts of measurement and forecast data. You will work closely with other Python developers in the team and department to ensure the applications are functional and meet our coding standards. These applications play a crucial role in the efficient use and safety of the electricity grid, including the management of EV-car charging stations, wind turbines, and solar power stations. We contribute to the energy transition, for everyone, with everyone. And as Python developer you can take your part in this transition. Your role involves: 


analysing and optimising database structures and queries to allow high throughput and enable persistence of large amounts of measurement data;
collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop REST APIs and Event-Driven interfaces using Kafka, capable of processing large datasets.
writing clean and reusable Python code that aligns with our commitment to code quality.
ensuring software quality through unit- and integration testing.
optimising application performance, maintaining software quality- and deployment pipelines and engaging in technical discussions to address and meet design requirements.


You complete our network 

Did you know that Alliander is made up of different companies? Together with Liander, Qirion, Qterra, Dep, Firan and Entrnce, we develop and manage the energy grid for millions of people in the Netherlands. And in the light of the current energy transition, that is no easy task. We are realising this transition with a large group of talented professionals. Thanks to them, we have every confidence that we will be able to safeguard the Netherlands’ energy future. Together with you, we will make this happen.

Getting the latest tools operational is only possible with the right motivation. We offer you an inspiring working environment. Databrokers Dynamic Data (DDD) Scrum team is a group of seven developers, supported by a dedicated Product Owner and an Architect. Their mission is to ensure that measurement and forecasting data is readily available to other teams within System Operations. The team members are committed to collaboration, code quality, a culture of continuous improvement, equality and autonomy.

You boost our network   

Do you want to work with the latest technologies and innovations? With your talent and experience you can contribute to our results and success. We are particularly looking for someone with:  


experience in handling large databases and query optimizations, preferably PostgreSQL;
a minimum of 3 years of experience as a (Python) developer;
proficiency in building and utilizing REST APIs in a microservice environment;
strong teamwork skills and a problem-solving mindset;
proficiency in English (System Operations main language) and/or Dutch.


Better organised for you 

Based on a 38-hour working week, you will receive:  


a gross monthly salary of € 4.274 to € 7.079
annually an Individual Choice Budget (IKB) of 18% (full time) or 12.8% (part time) of your gross annual salary. This includes 5.2% ADV (shorter working hours) and 8% holiday allowance. If you do not work full time, you are not entitled to ADV. You can have this budget paid out as extra salary or use it to purchase extra days off, for example. You choose the option that is right for you.
25 days’ holiday (statutory + non-statutory). You can use your IKB to top this up to (full time) (part time).
an end-of-year bonus of 6% of your annual salary in December.
the possibility to work from home or the offices in Arnhem or Amsterdam; 
a Sustainable Employability Budget of €500 per year. This can be used for expenses such as your sports subscription or coaching, as well as ergonomic home office furniture, career development, or professional literature. 


And we obviously offer much more! Read more about all the terms of employment.

 

More information for you 

Together, we make our network better. For everyone, with everyone. And you are part of that! Apply by clicking the application button on this vacancy before 30th November 2024. You will receive a reply from us within 5 working days.

 

Your application procedure may involve an assessment or screening. You will find more information in our screening conditions. Want to know more about the job content, or the selection procedure or the screening? Venetia de Wit, Corporate Recruiter IT, can tell you more on venetia.de.wit@alliander.com.

Venetia de Wit

HTML:
The energy transition needs you as a Python developer

As a Medior/Senior Python Back-end Developer, you will play a pivotal role in the department System Operations, contributing to the development and management of applications and APIs that handle vast amounts of measurement and forecast data. You will work closely with other Python developers in the team and department to ensure the applications are functional and meet our coding standards. These applications play a crucial role in the efficient use and safety of the electricity grid, including the management of EV-car charging stations, wind turbines, and solar power stations. We contribute to the energy transition, for everyone, with everyone. And as Python developer you can take your part in this transition. Your role involves: 

  • analysing and optimising database structures and queries to allow high throughput and enable persistence of large amounts of measurement data;
  • collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop REST APIs and Event-Driven interfaces using Kafka, capable of processing large datasets.
  • writing clean and reusable Python code that aligns with our commitment to code quality.
  • ensuring software quality through unit- and integration testing.
  • optimising application performance, maintaining software quality- and deployment pipelines and engaging in technical discussions to address and meet design requirements.

You complete our network 

Did you know that Alliander is made up of different companies? Together with Liander, Qirion, Qterra, Dep, Firan and Entrnce, we develop and manage the energy grid for millions of people in the Netherlands. And in the light of the current energy transition, that is no easy task. We are realising this transition with a large group of talented professionals. Thanks to them, we have every confidence that we will be able to safeguard the Netherlands’ energy future. Together with you, we will make this happen.

Getting the latest tools operational is only possible with the right motivation. We offer you an inspiring working environment. Databrokers Dynamic Data (DDD) Scrum team is a group of seven developers, supported by a dedicated Product Owner and an Architect. Their mission is to ensure that measurement and forecasting data is readily available to other teams within System Operations. The team members are committed to collaboration, code quality, a culture of continuous improvement, equality and autonomy.

You boost our network   

Do you want to work with the latest technologies and innovations? With your talent and experience you can contribute to our results and success. We are particularly looking for someone with:  

  • experience in handling large databases and query optimizations, preferably PostgreSQL;
  • a minimum of 3 years of experience as a (Python) developer;
  • proficiency in building and utilizing REST APIs in a microservice environment;
  • strong teamwork skills and a problem-solving mindset;
  • proficiency in English (System Operations main language) and/or Dutch.

Better organised for you 

Based on a 38-hour working week, you will receive:  

  • a gross monthly salary of € 4.274 to € 7.079
  • annually an Individual Choice Budget (IKB) of 18% (full time) or 12.8% (part time) of your gross annual salary. This includes 5.2% ADV (shorter working hours) and 8% holiday allowance. If you do not work full time, you are not entitled to ADV. You can have this budget paid out as extra salary or use it to purchase extra days off, for example. You choose the option that is right for you.
  • 25 days’ holiday (statutory + non-statutory). You can use your IKB to top this up to (full time) (part time).
  • an end-of-year bonus of 6% of your annual salary in December.
  • the possibility to work from home or the offices in Arnhem or Amsterdam; 
  • a Sustainable Employability Budget of €500 per year. This can be used for expenses such as your sports subscription or coaching, as well as ergonomic home office furniture, career development, or professional literature. 

And we obviously offer much more! Read more about all the terms of employment.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for an innovative and passionate Machine Learning Engineer to join our fast-paced, dynamic team. As a key member of our technology division, you will play a vital role in developing, deploying, and optimizing end-to-end machine learning models. This role demands expertise in MLOps (Machine Learning Operations) and the ability to handle the entire machine learning lifecycle—from data ingestion to model deployment and beyond.

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Oppizi, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers and product managers, to deliver high-quality ML solutions that directly impact business outcomes. You will also be responsible for ensuring that our models are scalable, efficient, and aligned with the company's goals.

Key Responsibilities:


Model Development and Deployment: Design, implement, and deploy machine learning models that address business needs, ensuring high availability and performance in production environments
MLOps and Automation: Apply MLOps best practices to automate the ML lifecycle, including data ingestion, training, and deployment pipelines. Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and delivery
Performance Monitoring and Optimization: Monitor deployed models to ensure they meet performance metrics, and continuously improve them for accuracy and scalability
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with software engineers, product managers, and other stakeholders to develop and communicate ML solutions effectively



Requirements

What are you bringing to the team:


Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field
Experience: Minimum of 4 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar role
MLOps Expertise: Proven experience with MLOps tools and frameworks (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, TensorFlow Extended)
Programming Skills: Strong proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Scikit-learn
Cloud & Containerization: Hands-on experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, and familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
Data & API Proficiency: Experience with data manipulation and building APIs using frameworks such as FastAPI, Flask, or Django
Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders


Nice to have:


Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark)
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools



Benefits

Competitive salary (open to negotiation) with performance-based bonuses.

Professional growth opportunities in a fast-growing startup.

Flexible working hours and remote work options.

Title: Data Scientist (Trust & Transparency)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

A core value proposition of Trustpilot is Trust. We work hard to ensure that our platform has genuine content from real people with real experiences. That means eliminating fake reviews and acting on signs of suspicious behavior to protect our platform from fraudulent activity. Our Trust Applied AI team’s mission is to use advanced modeling to safeguard the integrity of online reviews, and we have several cross-functional teams devoted to Trust where Applied AI is integral to achieving our goals.

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Trust team. You and your team will work to develop, deploy, and maintain innovative models at scale, alongside a cross-functional team of software developers, product managers, ML engineers, and designers. You will have the opportunity to collaborate widely across the business with our Technology and Product teams. You will also work closely with stakeholders in Legal and Platform Integrity.

To succeed in this role, you should have proven experience in developing and deploying ML models. You need a strong technical foundation and hands-on experience in all stages of data preparation, exploration, and modeling. An adaptable mindset and understanding of the interface between Applied AI and engineering are essential as you will be working in cross-disciplinary teams. Experience with deploying solutions into production is expected, as you will be responsible for implementing end-to-end solutions—from data pre-processing to serving predictions.

What You Will Do


Be hands-on in delivering the Applied AI / Data Science component of key strategic projects in Trust, from building and fine-tuning language models to sequence modeling, anomaly detection, collaborative filtering, user segmentation, etc.
Develop, maintain, and deploy production-ready ML models, with tooling support from ML engineers
Engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders and contribute to the Trust roadmap
Seize the chance to meaningfully influence our business through the latest advancements in Applied AI and keep Trustpilot on the edge of innovation when it comes to fake review detection
The opportunity to work with market-standard data engineering and deployment technologies including Google Vertex AI tools, Google BigQuery, and AWS, and with leading Data Science tools and emerging technologies for model building and deployment
Opportunities to develop your career in a friendly, diverse, international team and workplace


Who You Are


Experience with analysis and quantitative problem-solving using advanced statistical techniques and machine learning methods, e.g. anomaly detection, sequence modeling, classification, and semi-supervised/active learning, as well as deep learning methods (e.g. for language problems and graphs)
Experience in building and deploying production-ready ML models at scale, and solid data engineering skills (e.g. experience with cloud technologies - we use GCP but experience with AWS or Azure will also be fine)
Ability in Python and SQL for data manipulation, modeling, and scripting
Experience in working with large datasets, ideally from tech platforms, e-commerce, or SaaS-type businesses. Knowledge of behavioral data, detecting misbehavior or fraud at scale is a big plus
Knowledge of data pipelining and prior experience with cloud-based ML model deployments
Great communication skills - both with technical colleagues and with business stakeholders
Proven 3+ years of technical experience in a Data Science role, particularly in the technology sector or in a technical consultancy


What's In It For You


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

We offer flexibility and are offering these roles to work hybrid with a mixture of office and remote working, or if you are looking to be fully remote we are open to discussing this too! (As long as you are based in the UK or Denmark)

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 67 million monthly active users across the globe, with 127 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.


Show more

Title: Data Scientist - Go-to-Market (GTM) Applied AI team
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

From reviews to user behaviors to internal systems, at Trustpilot, we truly have big data. Every month, more than half a million new reviews are posted on Trustpilot for thousands of businesses. We have now reached 267 million reviews - and that is growing! - from consumers around the world. Our Data Scientists in the GTM Applied AI team leverage this data to build AI/ML models that improve our go-to-market (GTM) efficiency and enhance our pricing and revenue management strategy.

We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist to join our GTM Applied AI team to develop, deploy, and maintain our GTM and Pricing models. You will collaborate closely with our pricing and monetization squad and team of software developers, data analytics and ML engineers to develop, deploy, and maintain innovative AI/ML models at scale. You will be part of a unique journey where data, AI, and ML are at the heart of our product and company strategy. This role offers the opportunity to collaborate broadly across the business, including with our Commercial, Digital Sales, and Applied AI teams, in both B2B and B2C contexts.

To succeed in this role, you should have proven experience in developing and deploying AI/ML models to enhance commercial practices. You have a solid technical background, with hands-on ability in all stages of data preparation, exploration, and modeling. You must have an adaptable commercial mindset and knowledge of the interface between data science and engineering. The ability to develop AI/ML solutions, engage stakeholders, and clearly articulate the impact of your work is necessary for this role. Experience putting solutions into production within an interdisciplinary team is a big plus, and it will be ideal if you also have experience using AI and ML to solve pricing and revenue management problems.

What You’ll Be Doing


You will be involved in delivering some of our most exciting Data Science projects aimed at improving our GTM efficiency and pricing practices: from prediction to ranking, segmentation to NLP, and recommendation systems to content generation.
This is a great opportunity to make a real business impact by applying the state of the art in AI and ML.
You will deliver the Data Science component of key strategic initiatives including owning, maintaining, and deploying production-ready ML/AI models, and analysing data to establish the scope and impact of your work.
You will identify new pricing and monetization opportunities based on data, interpreting model outcomes, and share insights to drive the direction of our business goals.
You will engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders & will translate business requirements into Data Science deliverables.
The opportunity to work with leading data engineering technologies including Google Vertex AI tools, Google BigQuery, and AWS, and with leading Data Science tools and emerging technologies for model building and deployment.
Opportunities to develop your career in a friendly, diverse, innovative, international team and workplace.


Who You Are


Experience with analytical and quantitative problem solving using advanced statistical techniques and machine learning methods, e.g. Attribution, Segmentation, Churn, Upgrade, Upsell, and Pricing & Packaging.
Experience in building and deploying production-ready ML models, and solid data engineering skills (e.g. experience with cloud technologies - we use GCP but experience with AWS will also be fine).
Ability in Python and SQL for data manipulation, modeling, and scripting.
You have experience of working with large datasets. Knowledge of the data generated by websites or in the eCommerce sector, behavioral analytics, and experience working with data from commercial systems (e.g. Salesforce) is advantageous.
Knowledge of data pipelining and prior experience of cloud-based ML model deployments is beneficial.
Great communication skills - both with technical colleagues and with business stakeholders.
Proven technical experience in a Data Science role, particularly in the technology sector or in a technical consultancy.


What’s In It For You


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Newly renovated central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops
Tax-Free Travel (DSB)


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 67 million monthly active users across the globe, with 127 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.
