  • The opportunity to work with leading data engineering technologies including Google Vertex AI tools, Google BigQuery, and AWS, and with leading Data Science tools and emerging technologies for model building and deployment.
  • Opportunities to develop your career in a friendly, diverse, innovative, international team and workplace.

Who You Are

  • Experience with analytical and quantitative problem solving using advanced statistical techniques and machine learning methods, e.g. Attribution, Segmentation, Churn, Upgrade, Upsell, and Pricing & Packaging.
  • Experience in building and deploying production-ready ML models, and solid data engineering skills (e.g. experience with cloud technologies - we use GCP but experience with AWS will also be fine).
  • Ability in Python and SQL for data manipulation, modeling, and scripting.
  • You have experience of working with large datasets. Knowledge of the data generated by websites or in the eCommerce sector, behavioral analytics, and experience working with data from commercial systems (e.g. Salesforce) is advantageous.
  • Knowledge of data pipelining and prior experience of cloud-based ML model deployments is beneficial.
  • Great communication skills - both with technical colleagues and with business stakeholders.
  • Proven technical experience in a Data Science role, particularly in the technology sector or in a technical consultancy.

What’s In It For You

  • A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
  • Competitive compensation package + bonus
  • 25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
  • Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
  • Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
  • Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
  • Paid parental leave
  • Newly renovated central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
  • Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
  • Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
  • Employee discounts to restaurants and shops
  • Tax-Free Travel (DSB)

Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 67 million monthly active users across the globe, with 127 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Title: Data Scientist - LLM
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 4 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with PST time zone

Standard work hours are 8 AM PST - 4 PM PST.

Must-Have


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming.
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.


Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)

3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence

Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - LLM
Description:
LLM - Python for Machine Learning

Experience: 2 - 15 Years

Location- Permanent Remote Anywhere in the world

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 5 hours Mandatory overlap with PST

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years Mandatory

Mandatory Skills- Python: min 2 years, Python for Data Science: min 1 yr, Machine Learning: min 1 yr, PyTorch: min 1 yr, Keras: min 1 yr, Tensorflow: min 1 yr

Key skills: Python, ML, PyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow

Job Responsibilities


Develop, train, and deploy machine learning models using TensorFlow and/or PyTorch.
Implement machine learning models and preprocessing pipelines using Scikit-learn.
Apply supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, including SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forest, and k-NN, to solve complex problems.
Design and implement deep learning architectures such as CNNs, RNNs, GANs, and transfer learning models.
Explore and apply reinforcement learning techniques to enhance AI solutions.


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 2+ years of experience as a Python-focused Engineer.
1+ years of experience with Python-based frameworks for machine learning.
Proficiency in TensorFlow and/or PyTorch for model development and deployment.
Strong knowledge of Scikit-learn for machine learning model implementation.
In-depth understanding of supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, as well as deep learning architectures.


Nice To Have


Experience with Keras for quick prototyping of deep learning models.
Proficiency in Pandas and Numpy for data manipulation and preprocessing.
Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications in AI.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to research and build advanced analytics solutions using the latest tech? Are you looking to have a global impact by productionizing state-of-the-art advanced analytics solutions?




If so, apply to become a data scientist in our Advanced Analytics & AI team and help build world class solutions, work with the latest technologies and enjoy a fun and learning-oriented environment.




Join our Data & AI tech hub in Copenhagen

We lead the global data science initiatives and capabilities across ECCO Group and drive an ambitious strategy to fundamentally improve how ECCO operates based on data. This means working with the entire value chain – from logistics and sales to marketing, pricing and store operations.




As a Data Scientist, you will develop, implement and deliver data science solutions, ranging from exploratory analyses to automated solutions in production. You will learn how we work with DevOps and DataOps Pipelines, and you will be part of deploying and maintaining solutions.

Furthermore, you will:




Be part of a well-established Data Science & Machine Learning product team, working closely together with skilled ML engineers and (Sr) Data Scientists
Develop new and existing data science products, e.g. for price optimisation, inventory management, marketing analytics, consumer analytics, pricing, demand sensing, etc.
Clean, prepare and synthesise data for use in descriptive analysis, as well as predictive, prescriptive and generative models
Develop and implement machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) algorithms for real-world problems by using supervised, unsupervised, semi-unsupervised and reinforcement learning
Deliver solutions based on a modern data platform that is delivered by a state-of-the-art Data Platform team




You enjoy learning while solving real problems

You are always interested in learning new technologies and ways of working. And if there’s something you don’t know, we are the perfect place to learn it. We imagine that you:




Have (or will soon complete) a master’s degree or PhD in a quantitative discipline, e.g. statistics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, physics or economics
Haven proven your ability to excel (e.g., excellent academic record, extra-curricular activities), however previous full-time work experience is not required
Know at least one programming language, ideally python
Are familiar with modern cloud-based data tech stacks; although this is a plus, not a requirement, if you don’t we will teach you!
Are fluent in English and have solid communication skills; fluency in Danish is a plus.




We tackle an endless range of new opportunities

You can look forward to joining a tech hub with 30+ highly skilled, motivated, collaborative and fun-loving colleagues. We share an entrepreneurial spirit and a bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment, explore and innovate, we are tackling an endless range of new opportunities.




We are always ready to implement new technologies into our workflow. In addition, your continued personal and professional development is essential to us, and we offer participation in internal and external courses, education and conferences supporting this development.




Are you ready for your next challenge?

We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so do not hesitate to apply. For additional information, you can reach out to Head of Advanced Analytics & AI, Thomas Jauho THJAU@ecco.com.




Imagining yourself at ECCO? Get a glimpse of what your new exciting career entails on https://enter.ecco.com.




CREATE THE FOOTPRINTS OF TOMORROW

At ECCO, you become part of a meaningful, developing and multicultural workplace. You join a global family of more than 23,000 people who are proud to create the footprints of tomorrow.




Headquartered in Denmark, we are a family-owned company that offers international opportunities. Our offices and facilities have an informal culture and relaxed dress code - our shoe code is slightly stricter.




Join us and we guarantee lifelong learning - the speed of progress is up to you. So, if you´re curious, passionate and ready to make an impact, you´ll fit right in.

Show more

Title: Sr Data Scientist - LLM
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 4 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with PST time zone

Standard work hours are 8 AM PST - 4 PM PST.

Must-Have


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming.
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.


Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you our new Data Scientist?




AudienceProject is looking for a Data Scientist for our Copenhagen office to support our continued growth.

—




Are you an analyst at heart? And do you have an interest in data modeling and programming? Then we have an opportunity for a career in a fast-growing scale-up that directly cooperates with companies such as Meta, Google, Amazon, Netflix, etc.




AudienceProject is a leading SaaS company with 80+ employees delivering audience measurement and research solutions to major advertisers, agencies, and publishers across Europe.




Our platform enables clients to better understand the reach and effect of their campaigns across channels, helping them make confident marketing decisions to reach and impact their audiences more effectively.




Embarking on our second decade of audience measurement, we are now looking for a motivated Data Scientist to join our Data Science Research team.




Joining AudienceProject will give you a front-row seat in the rapidly evolving marketing technology sector and an opportunity to work within a respected business, delivering insights about audiences across the world's largest media channels to top-tier clients and some of the world’s biggest brands.




What you will do




You will be tasked with developing and implementing new methodologies related to both our platform as well as work on bespoke solutions for top-tier clients.




In the Data Science Research team, you will work with seven other team members and have close collaboration with the developers in our Tech department. The team is small and dynamic, and there is plenty of room for innovation and good ideas are quickly turned into action.

You will use Databricks notebooks hosted on our cloud servers to interact with S3 for exploratory data analysis, visualizations and modeling. This is done in PySpark (or SparkR) since the vast amounts of data truly require distributed computing.

Essential qualifications

You have a Master's degree or higher education, preferably from a social science background specializing in statistics and data analysis or a numerically oriented education.
You have experience with data wrangling and analysis of large datasets and have developed a good intuition for how data can be used to create business insights.
You have a solid understanding of classical statistics techniques, including various regression analyses.
You have programming/scripting skills. Our current toolbox includes Python and R. It is an advantage to have good knowledge of at least one of these languages, as the position is primarily programming-oriented.
You are curious, structured, and goal-oriented. You enjoy diving into complex issues but understand that the goal is to find workable solutions.
You can communicate your results in a non-technical manner and understand how to make complex data analysis useful for non-data scientists.

Further qualifications

Experience working with simulations, Bayesian statistics, and machine learning models.
Experience with "human-centered" analysis and experience with analyzing attitudinal data, such as survey and/or online behavioral data.
An ability to understand the business implications of data and how to use it to build a strategic story that engages customers.

Relevant working experience is viewed as a plus but is not a strict requirement.




What we offer




A unique career opportunity in a fast-growing scale-up full of curious, intelligent and creative people where you can grow as we grow our company.




Competitive salary
Pension scheme and health insurance
Home internet paid
Central Copenhagen office
Hybrid work model
Daily breakfast
Lunch made by an on-site chef
Unlimited snacks, drinks and coffee
Friday bars and quarterly company dinners
International environment
Friendly, supportive and helpful colleagues
Innovative and market-leading products and services
Exposure to a lot of data handling
Technically/commercially challenging tasks
Working directly with some of the most modern and successful companies of our time
Mentorship from thought leaders in the industry




Send us your application




If you can see yourself in the above and want to work for a leading SaaS company, we want to hear from you.




If you have any questions about the position, please contact Jacob Daniel Kirstejn Hansen at jacobh@audienceproject.com.




We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so please don’t hesitate to send your application. Apply by filling out the application form: https://share.hsforms.com/15Mw2OSWQQo-N78GVJfcsNw21v9v.




The deadline for applications is October 20th, 2024. We will be inviting applicants for interviews on an ongoing basis.




We look forward to receiving your application!

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Jacob Daniel Kirstejn Hansen at jacobh@audienceproject.com.


We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so please don’t hesitate to send your application. Apply by filling out the application form: https://share.hsforms.com/15Mw2OSWQQo-N78GVJfcsNw21v9v.


The deadline for applications is October 20th, 2024. We will be inviting applicants for interviews on an ongoing basis.


We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Internship: Data Scientist
Description:
Internship:
Data Scientist

Dreaming of working with high-quality software that makes a real difference? Then seize this opportunity and apply for an internship as a Data Scientist at Systematic!

More than just an internship
As a Data Scientist intern, you will join our SitaWare Insight team which is part of our Defence business unit. SitaWare Insight is a decision-support tool that transforms data collection and management, providing commanders at various levels with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities. The mission for the program is to simplify critical decision-making. Modern technologies like AI are used to transform data into information, providing commanders with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities.

As an intern, you will play a vital role in the team, contribute to the advancement of modern technologies and be treated on a par with the other employees. Moreover, you will become an integrated part of a team from day one, receiving the professional sparring and feedback you need to succeed.

Freedom With Responsibilities
Our new intern will get to make a real difference working with high-quality software, while you will have every opportunity to apply what you have learnt so far on your study programme. In addition, some of your daily tasks include contributing to daily advancements and developing and documenting code according to agile principles while using Python and other relevant technologies.

In so far as possible, you will be able to plan your own tasks as we strive to create the right balance between your personal wishes, your formal study requirements and our expectations.

You are our new intern
… if you are studying for a BSc or MSc in Cognitive Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Engineering or similar. And if you work systematically, are motivated by the quality of your work and always maintain a focus on the details.

Throughout your internship, the focus will be on developing your competencies, which we envisage are as follows:


You take an interest in, are knowledgeable about or have experience with LLMs and natural language processing methods.
You possess experience at developing or implementing machine learning models.
You are proficient with Python and popular ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Transformers or TensorFlow.
You are proficient in data preprocessing and feature engineering.
You understand data handling, model evaluation, the visualisation of data-driven solutions and the development of best practices.
You speak and write English fluently as it is our corporate language. It is also an advantage if you can speak Danish, but this is not a requirement. 



Practical information  

The internship lasts five months, starting 3 February 2025. 
The internship is a full-time position.
When applying, please include your CV as well as your exam certificates. 
We will be assessing job applications as we receive them, as we are keen to fill the position as soon as possible. We look forward to hearing from you!  



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.  

  

Never stop developing   

Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.   

 

In addition to your team, you will become part of an Intern network with other Interns at Systematic, providing you with a rich opportunity to network across the organisation. You can also look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 social/professional events a year. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!  

  

Start your development here  

We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Helene Overgaard Bach, Junior Consultant, People Attraction.

Get in touch

Helene Overgaard Bach

Junior Consultant
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer Lead - LLM/Python/GenAI
Description:
Opportunity: Full Time, 8 hours India time

Contract length: 6-12 Months

Must-Have

Total Years Of exp- 7+ years experience mandatory

Mandatory Skills: Python- 7 years, Machine Learning - 3 years, LLM - 3 years.

Solid understanding of cloud services, including Azure, GCP, or AWS

Introduction

We are seeking experienced professionals with expertise in Large Language Models (LLM) to join a dynamic team working on next-generation products. In this role, you will collaborate with other engineers across various skill sets, driving innovative solutions for our clients.

Required Skills


7+ years of professional experience in building Machine Learning models & systems
1+ years of hands-on experience with LLMs and Generative AI, particularly prompt engineering, RAG, and agents
Expertise in business analysis, requirement gathering, and solution workflow design for GenAI/ML projects
Proven ability to drive client engagement and align development teams toward a technical roadmap
Proficient in programming with Python, Langchain, and SQL
Solid understanding of cloud services, including Azure, GCP, or AWS
Excellent communication skills for effective collaboration with business SMEs

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further.

Does this sound highly appealing to you? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Researcher at Alipes Capital.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




To accomplish our mission of being the best at what we do, we understand the importance of elevating our predictive modeling standards to the highest levels. Your work will involve leading the efforts in creating a world class modeling workflow, enabling the team to seamlessly turn massive data sets of financial information into mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the financial markets.




In doing so, you will get a chance to tackle a variety of software infrastructure challenges, such as:

Development and optimization of calibration and benchmarking frameworks
Building out and implementing best practices for data preparation and dataset generation pipelines
Prototyping and releasing novel predictive architectures, especially with respect to time-series models.




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.




About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering 6 nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About you

Fluency within mathematics and statistics
Experience working with the full Machine Learning stack from data generation through model calibration and real-life validation and monitoring
Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
Proficiency with computer science fundamentals
A scientific and inquisitive mind




Nice to have

Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Programming experience with languages like C# and C/C++
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics or economics




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Show more

Title: DATA SCIENCE CONSULTANT COPENHAGEN
Description:
Role:




Statistical data processing (Data Mining)
Artificial Intelligence (AI), including generative AI
Predictive modeling using Machine Learning and Data Science techniques
Time-series modeling (ARIMA and panel data models) and simulation models (Monte Carlo)
Development, validation and audit of financial, risk, marketing and business-oriented models
R&D projects




Requirements:




Recent graduates or final year students.
Should desirably have knowledge of Artificial Intelligence modeling techniques (logit, GLM, time series, random forests, clustering, XGBoost), statistical programming languages (SAS, R, Python, Matlab), big data tools and platforms (Hadoop, Hive, etc.) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Solid academic record.
Strong computer skills.
Postgraduate studies and/or specialized courses are an asset, especially in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Quantitative Finance or similar.
Knowledge of other languages is desirable.
Get-up-and-go attitude, maturity, responsibility and strong work ethic.
Strong ability to learn quickly.
Able to integrate easily into multidisciplinary teams.




What we offer:




We offer you the possibility to join a firm that provides all you need to develop your talent to the fullest:




Working in the highest-profile consulting projects in the industry,
for the largest companies, leaders of their respective markets,
alongside top industry management as they face challenges at the national and global level,
as part of an extraordinary team of professionals whose values and corporate culture are a benchmark for the industry




Training:

Ongoing training plan, with approximately 10% of business turnover spent on training.
Specialist knowledge courses, external expert courses, professional skills courses and language courses.
Last year our staff as a whole received over 350,000 hours of training spanning more than 150 courses.




Career plan:

Clearly defined career plan.
Internal promotion based solely on merit.
Partnership-based management model offers all professionals the opportunity to become part of the Firm’s group of partners




Complementary experiences:




University: we maintain a close relationship with the world’s most prestigious universities.
Social Action: we organize more than 30 community support activities.
Sports Club: internal and external tournaments.




How to apply:




If you are interested in our offer, please complete our application form online at https://www.managementsolutions.com/en/professional-careers-send-us-your-cv

Title: Python Developer - LLM
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 3 - 6 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

Title: Data Scientist & Startup Founder (March 2025)
Description:
This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.




Who you are:

You are a highly skilled technical professional with a proven track record in developing innovative solutions. Your strong programming abilities and experience in building complex algorithms enable you to address critical challenges within the tech industry. You are a proactive individual with a passion for progress, driven to make a significant impact through cutting-edge technological advancements.




The Antler Founder Residency

Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.

12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Copenhagen.
Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!




Program Details

Start Date: March 3rd, 2025
Location: Onsite at our Copenhagen office
Compensation: While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
Visa Sponsorship: Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.




For our March 2025 cohort, we're looking for someone who:

Excel in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI, with a knack for advancing technology.
Can unearth insights from intricate data, leading in ML methodologies.
Embrace the challenge of merging diverse data for revolutionary models.
Are adept at prototyping innovative solutions that pave the way for real-world applications.
Navigate product development with strategic foresight and precision.
Experienced in the start-up ecosystem
Optional: have an idea that solves a problem you’re passionate about, but you understand the need for co-pilots who share your vision and values




Application Process

Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:

Apply through our website.
Participate in an introductory interview.
Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
Receive a potential offer.




Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:

Wingbits: A community-driven flight data tracking platform
Two: A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
Evyon: A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
Glint Solar: Software accelerating the identification of optimal solar installation sites.
PerPlant: AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

Title: Software Engineer to ALTEN Denmark
Description:
Are you a talented Software Engineer seeking your next opportunity? Join our Engineering team in Denmark, where exciting challenges await!

Your role as Software Engineer:

As a Software Engineer at ALTEN, you will play a key role in strengthening the section for integration of software and hardware. You will be a part of a talented team where you develop state of the art technology together with electronics engineers, firmware and software developers.

Who are you?

To be a good match for the role we we believe that you have a great experience in C++, it could be both close to the hardware or object oriented. Experience in C is also of interest. You are a driven and engaged colleague with a problem-solving mind and a team player. We also see that you have a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, or other equivalent education and at least 5+ years of experience within a relevant area.




We also think our new colleague have experience from:

Python or Java
SQL
Machine learning (TensorFloe, Scikit-learn)
Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google cloud)




It is meritorious if you also have:

experience of UX design
experience working with control algorithms
experience of version control systems




Location: Aarhus, Denmark.




The recruitment process is ongoing- if you are interested do not hesitate to apply right away!




As part of our team, you can expect the following:

Full-time employment at ALTEN Denmark

Opportunities for international mobility

Access to internal education, certifications, and professional development programs offered by ALTEN Academy

Diverse range of assignments with different clients and industries

Career coaching and guidance with the support of our dedicated Business Managers




About ALTEN:

ALTEN is a leading provider of outsourced Engineering and Technology Services, operating in over 35 countries with a workforce of more than 57,000 employees. In Denmark, ALTEN has been on a successful growth trajectory since 2019, delivering innovative solutions within Engineering and Life Science. Our team of skilled engineers undertakes complex and technically demanding projects across various industries, collaborating with renowned companies throughout the value chain and are presented in various locations in Denmark!

Title: Experienced Data Scientist
Description:
Be a key player for the success of our cutting-edge AI healthcare products.

Are you a passionate data scientist with a desire to make an impact in the healthcare sector? Systematic Healthcare is seeking an experienced Data Scientist to develop cutting-edge AI for our healthcare products. As a Data Scientist, you will be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge AI and machine learning models, ensuring seamless integration with our healthcare products. Join us and become part of a dynamic team that simplifies critical decision-making for healthcare professionals worldwide.

About Our Team
At Systematic, we foster a supportive and collaborative work environment where your contributions are valued and encouraged. We believe in nurturing talent and providing ample opportunities for career growth. You will be working close together with other data scientists and architects. The team is based on informal communication and mutual trust in each other’s expertise.

Build AI solutions for Systematic Healthcare
In Systematic, our mission is to have a positive impact on the world stage by supporting our customers in critical decision making in critical environments. We are looking for new team members that can help contribute to our mission. Here, you will come across exciting challenges that are unique to our domain.

You will be part of shaping the future of our AI innovation and development of healthcare products in this hands-on Data Scientist role. You will contribute as a key player to innovation around ML/AI for our healthcare products, introducing novel capabilities and overall product enhancements.

Key responsibilities:


Work with a variety of machine learning tasks such as natural language processing, speech recognition, anomaly detection and more
Be involved in all phases of the data science workflow including clarification, experimentation, modelling, testing, communicating, and deploying data driven solutions
Collaborate with product managers, product owners and domain experts
Participate in technical sparring sessions and code inspections
Think innovatively by coming up with ideas and improvements



About You
To thrive in this role, you should bring a few years of experience and curiosity to the table.

We are looking for candidates who possesses the following qualifications:


Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks model development (e.g. PyTorch and Tensorflow)
Experience with LLM and prompting
Solid understanding of model evaluation, documentation, visualization of data-driven solutions and development best-practices
Experience with Docker and FastAPI
Appreciate teamwork and sparring
Great communication skills
Proficient in English



Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club offering almost 100 social/professional events a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Jacob Elgaard Manager.

Get in touch

Sofie Heiner Emborg

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more

Title: Python Developer - LLM
Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 3 - 6 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Stillingsbeskrivelse

Vil du være med til at udvikle nogle af branchens vigtigste og mest komplekse IT-løsninger? Som Software Developer i Netcompany vil du være med til at gøre en mærkbar forskel for både vores offentlige og private kunder.

Arbejdsopgaver og teknologi

Som Software Developer vil du blive en del af vores Netcompany Application Services, der består af en fast teamstruktur, der driver porteføljer af spændende kunder og projekter. Din hverdag vil være præget af både tekniske og kunderettede opgaver med leverancer, der spænder fra nyudvikling af IT-projekter til løbende udvikling på eksisterende løsninger og serviceydelser.

I Netcompany leverer vi på alle markedsudbredte teknologier herunder .Net, C#, Java, Salesforce, Sharepoint, Dynamics CRM, Business Central ERP, Sitecore, ReactJS, Angular, Docker, Azure, Azure DevOps, Octopus, Oracle, Episerver m.fl. Valget af teknologi bestemmes altid efter, hvad der giver kunden størst værdi. Det er derfor vigtigt, at du synes, det er sjovt at arbejde med nye og varierende områder og teknologier samt finder det motiverende at udbygge din viden kontinuerligt.

Dine arbejdsopgaver kan bl.a. indebære:


Kundedialog og behovsafklaring
Implementering af funktioner i brugergrænsefladen
Programmering af frontend og backend til nye features i kundens løsninger
Opsætning og udvikling af frameworks samt integrationer
Konfiguration og udvikling af extensions til standardplatforme
Automatisering af forretningsprocesser i form af f.eks. batchjobs


Om dig

Vi forestiller os, at du er universitetsuddannet bachelor eller diplomingeniør inden for eksempelvis datalogi, software, IT eller lignende. Derudover forestiller vi os, at du:


Er nyuddannet eller har et par års erfaring - vigtigst er, at du brænder for at tage din karriere inden for IT til næste niveau
Besidder gode IT-tekniske kompetencer inden for objektorienteret programmering
Har et analytisk og problemløsende mindset, der gør dig i stand til at løse komplekse og tekniske opgaver for vores kunder


Fortsæt din udvikling hos os

I Netcompany har vi fokus på din personlige og faglige udvikling.

Når du starter hos os, får du en personlig mentor, som vil vejlede dig igennem din udvikling og i at nå dine mål. Den tætte relation til en erfaren kollega er med til at sikre trivsel for den enkelte medarbejder og giver dig samtidig konkret indblik i de mange forskellige karrieremuligheder, efterhånden som du opbygger din erfaring.

Derudover deltager du i vores uddannelsesprogram, Netcompany Academy, hvor du tilbydes kurser og seminarer, om alt fra teknologier til kundehåndtering. Alle kurser undervises af erfarne Netcompany kolleger, hvilket er med til at sikre, at alt indhold er af høj relevans og bygger ovenpå din faglighed, så du bliver godt klædt på til at varetage forskellige opgaver og hele tiden dygtiggør dig gennem din karriere hos os.

Bliv en del af et inkluderende fællesskab

I Netcompany prioriterer vi fællesskab højt. Vi fremmer aktivt en åben og imødekommende arbejdskultur, der bygger på samarbejde og tillid til hinanden, og hvor der altid er mulighed for sparring.

Det er en del af vores kultur og værdigrundlag, at alle medarbejdere, uanset baggrund, identitet og erfaring mødes med forståelse og respekt samt lige muligheder for udvikling og trivsel.

Du får mulighed for at opnå læring og samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af kulturer og nationaliteter, da vi som international virksomhed har kontorer i mange lande.

Vi tilbyder et fælles miljø, hvor vi engagerer os i hinanden på tværs af afdelinger og projekter. Hertil har vi en lang række af sociale og faglige arrangementer, der giver dig de bedste muligheder for at udvide og opbygge et netværk allerede tidligt i din karriere.

Send os en ansøgning

Upload dit CV og en motiveret ansøgning til vores rekrutteringssystem via linket. Har du ikke fået svar på alle dine spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at skrive til hr.dk@netcompany.com

Alle kvalificerede kandidater opfordres til at søge uanset køn, kønsudtryk, seksualitet, handicap, alder, religion og tro, politisk anskuelse, nationalitet, etnicitet eller sociale baggrund.

Vi er engagerede i at skabe et inkluderende og mangfoldigt miljø. Vores rekrutteringsprocesser er baseret på individuel merit. Hvis du har behov for tilpasninger eller ekstra støtte under ansættelsesprocessen, bedes du sende en e-mail til vores ansvarlige rekrutteringsmedarbejdere på reasonableadjustmentsdk@netcompany.com for hjælp.
Show more

Title: Senior React Native Software Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to join an exciting digital transformation journey and contribute to a cutting-edge platform that is shaping the future of banking in the Nordics?




Help us at Digital Banking, build, develop and maintain our NEoS (New E-bank and Sales Platform) banking app, used by more than 2 million end-customers across Denmark, Sweden, Norway and the Faroe Islands.




SDC’s “golden platform”

The future of SDC is our “New E-bank and Sales Platform” – better known as NEoS. Our award-winning platform provides Scandinavian banks and their end-customers with a modern, flexible, and open digital self-service solution tailored to the needs of the individual bank. NEoS aims to revolutionize the banking experience for both individual and business customers across web and app.




How is it to work at NEoS App Product Stream?

As part of SDC’s Digital Banking department, the “App Product Stream” offers an excellent opportunity to become part of a flat and agile department that will, no doubt, both challenge and sometimes frustrate the seasoned developer.

In our collaborative environment, your voice will be heard (and is expected to be expressed), and you'll collaborate with level-headed colleagues. Our teams are dedicated to self-development and continuous learning, always striving to improve and challenge the status quo. We embrace modern technologies and love experimenting with new innovations, all whilst sharing our knowledge with others.

You'll have the chance to hone and expand your skills alongside a team deeply focused on React Native. Day-to-day, you’ll engage with your colleagues, developing new features and closely partnering with your team on design, estimation, and implementation of features.

Working in SDC’s “App Product Stream” will offer you an opportunity to wield significant influence while collaborating cross-functionally with a talented international team of experienced engineers.

By the way, we work in a hybrid work environment, allowing you to work remotely or in the office as needed. We appreciate a healthy work-life balance for greater productivity.




What makes you successful in this role?

You are proficient in React Native, JavaScript/TypeScript and Redux/Redux-Saga. You have a flair for good UX and UI design, and you have experience working on large-scale IT projects.

You bring an engineering mindset and versatility that allow you to adapt to a broad knowledge domain. You are highly dedicated and take full responsibility for your work, ensuring that it is completed to the best of your ability and beyond.

You have a good balance between moving quickly and building long-term solutions. You're curious, innovative, enjoy tackling problems, and fluent in English.




Perks and benefits at SDC

30 days of paid vacation leave, plus 5 additional care-taker days (a total of 7 weeks off). We provide flexible working hours and private health and dental care for you and your family. At SDC, we also have a lot of exciting clubs such as a wine club, running club, theater club, and a Young Professionals Network.

When it's time to relax, you can take advantage of our SDC holiday apartments, available in Denmark, France and Spain, for you and your family. We also have an attractive pension scheme (11.65% of employer’s contribution), free parking, access to an affordable canteen, gym, holiday supplement (feriepenge) and more.

More about our benefits: https://www.sdc.dk/en/sdc/karriere/fordele-og-goder




We would love to hear from you

If you have any questions regarding the position, do not hesitate to contact Team Lead Jesper Mårtensson, via phone at +45 6110 3029 or email at jma@sdc.dk.

We will continuously review incoming applications and conduct interviews until we find the right candidates. Please submit your CV and cover letter.

Please note that we don’t consider unsolicited applications from agencies with whom we do not already have an agreement.




Additional Information

SDC is a full-service IT center that develops efficient banking solutions for millions of bank customers throughout the Nordic region. We were founded in 1963 when a number of small savings banks joined forces with the dream of economies of scale and digital bookkeeping. That dream still drives us. We call it "A great banking experience at a competitive price.”

In short, we offer small and medium-sized banks throughout the Nordic region efficient and user-friendly IT systems. This cross-Nordic collaboration makes us unique and enables us to work with economies of scale and share development costs.

We are more than 900 colleagues in offices in Ballerup, Warsaw, and Bergen.

Focusing on our internal values - "Winning Together", "Professional", and "Customer Oriented" - we work every day to meet the goals of the 2025 Strategy, "Execute Effective Banking".

You can find more information at www.sdc.dk

NEoS aims to revolutionize the banking experience for both individual and business customers across web and app.


How is it to work at NEoS App Product Stream?

As part of SDC’s Digital Banking department, the “App Product Stream” offers an excellent opportunity to become part of a flat and agile department that will, no doubt, both challenge and sometimes frustrate the seasoned developer.

In our collaborative environment, your voice will be heard (and is expected to be expressed), and you'll collaborate with level-headed colleagues. Our teams are dedicated to self-development and continuous learning, always striving to improve and challenge the status quo. We embrace modern technologies and love experimenting with new innovations, all whilst sharing our knowledge with others.

You'll have the chance to hone and expand your skills alongside a team deeply focused on React Native. Day-to-day, you’ll engage with your colleagues, developing new features and closely partnering with your team on design, estimation, and implementation of features.

Working in SDC’s “App Product Stream” will offer you an opportunity to wield significant influence while collaborating cross-functionally with a talented international team of experienced engineers.

By the way, we work in a hybrid work environment, allowing you to work remotely or in the office as needed. We appreciate a healthy work-life balance for greater productivity.


What makes you successful in this role?

You are proficient in React Native, JavaScript/TypeScript and Redux/Redux-Saga. You have a flair for good UX and UI design, and you have experience working on large-scale IT projects.

You bring an engineering mindset and versatility that allow you to adapt to a broad knowledge domain. You are highly dedicated and take full responsibility for your work, ensuring that it is completed to the best of your ability and beyond.

You have a good balance between moving quickly and building long-term solutions. You're curious, innovative, enjoy tackling problems, and fluent in English.


Perks and benefits at SDC

30 days of paid vacation leave, plus 5 additional care-taker days (a total of 7 weeks off). We provide flexible working hours and private health and dental care for you and your family. At SDC, we also have a lot of exciting clubs such as a wine club, running club, theater club, and a Young Professionals Network.

When it's time to relax, you can take advantage of our SDC holiday apartments, available in Denmark, France and Spain, for you and your family. We also have an attractive pension scheme (11.65% of employer’s contribution), free parking, access to an affordable canteen, gym, holiday supplement (feriepenge) and more.

More about our benefits: https://www.sdc.dk/en/sdc/karriere/fordele-og-goder


We would love to hear from you

If you have any questions regarding the position, do not hesitate to contact Team Lead Jesper Mårtensson, via phone at +45 6110 3029 or email at jma@sdc.dk.

We will continuously review incoming applications and conduct interviews until we find the right candidates. Please submit your CV and cover letter.

Please note that we don’t consider unsolicited applications from agencies with whom we do not already have an agreement.


Additional Information

SDC is a full-service IT center that develops efficient banking solutions for millions of bank customers throughout the Nordic region. We were founded in 1963 when a number of small savings banks joined forces with the dream of economies of scale and digital bookkeeping. That dream still drives us. We call it "A great banking experience at a competitive price.”

In short, we offer small and medium-sized banks throughout the Nordic region efficient and user-friendly IT systems. This cross-Nordic collaboration makes us unique and enables us to work with economies of scale and share development costs.

We are more than 900 colleagues in offices in Ballerup, Warsaw, and Bergen.

Focusing on our internal values - "Winning Together", "Professional", and "Customer Oriented" - we work every day to meet the goals of the 2025 Strategy, "Execute Effective Banking".

You can find more information at www.sdc.dk

Title: Python Developer - LLM
Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 2 - 10 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

Title: Platform Engineer (Python)
Description:
Join Our Team at Copenhagen Energy Trading

Platform Engineer (Python) in Copenhagen




We’re expanding our Tech Team at Copenhagen Energy Trading. We are seeking platform engineers with a software development background, preferably in Python, and with experience in making critical technological choices, designing, and implementing data stores and pipelines, and producing high-quality software with a keen focus on delivering value.




If your skills and interests align with this opportunity, and you're excited about working for a company dedicated to the energy transition, consider applying for this exciting opportunity at Copenhagen Energy Trading.




As a young and rapidly expanding energy trading firm, we welcome candidates with varying levels of experience. So don’t hesitate to apply if you only have a few years under your belt.




About The Role

As a Platform Engineer, you’ll be joining our Tech Team that is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the critical infrastructure and platform services powering our analytics and many of our business functions.




You will get to develop resilient front-end and back-end applications, understand and codify complex business logic, automate tests, define infrastructure-as-code and workflow deployments declaratively - and much more, but everything as code. We are a bunch of Pythonistas, but we're also flexible and open towards other languages, if needed.




What is especially intriguing about this role is the direct impact your contributions can have on the improvement of our trading operations. You will be seated close to your trading colleagues, which makes it easy to collaborate and share new ideas on how we can make our solutions even better.




The position will be based at our headquarters located in the district of Carlsberg City in Central Copenhagen.




Responsibilities

Software: Design and implement scalable, reliable, and efficient software solutions, including data pipelines for ingesting and transforming data. Help set and follow software best practices to influence the way we build, document, review and test our software. You must be a fighter of technical debt in code bases.
Infrastructure & Cloud: Work on enhancing our platform infrastructure spanning the entire data lifecycle from ingestion and data transformation to machine-learning model management and reporting. We are cloud-native and run on Azure. You and the team are responsible for developing and securing our cloud infrastructure.
Automation & DevOps: Automate processes and optimize DevOps practices to streamline development and deployment environments.
Security and Compliance: Ensure security, performance, and compliance standards in everything we do.
Containerization: Leverage containerization for deploying our applications, while ensuring the reliability and security of the containerized applications throughout their lifecycle.
Analysis: Conduct various ad hoc analyses to assist in decision-making processes. Often, this will involve running proof-of-concept experiments on new technologies and tools to enhance the platform’s capabilities.
Support: Participate in on-call rotations for platform support and maintenance, assisting in troubleshooting platform-related issues, and occasionally addressing other technology-related concerns within the company.




Qualifications and Experience

Education: A master’s or bachelor’s degree with a strong technological basis, e.g., Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or other relevant fields.
Software Development Experience: Proven proficiency in crafting Python software solutions that are not only functional but also production ready. Ideally, your experience should encompass managing challenges related to scalability, performance, and reliability.
Python Proficiency: A strong command of Python programming language is a must. If Event loops, context managers, type-hints and generators are all parts of your vocabulary, then that is awesome.
DevOps and Deployment: Experience with CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes) is advantageous. You should be comfortable deploying applications to cloud platforms like AWS or Azure. Big plus, if you have experience in achieving parity between production, staging and dev.
Database Skills: Some experience with database design, development, and optimization, preferably with PostgreSQL would be great.
Communication Skills: Excellent problem-solving and communication skills with full professional proficiency in English.
Electricity markets: A genuine interest in learning about electricity markets.
Technology-enthusiast: A strong enthusiasm for staying up to date with emerging technologies is like icing on the cake.




What We Offer

At Copenhagen Energy, we're committed to fostering a dynamic and inclusive work environment where your talents and contributions are recognized and valued. When you join our team, you'll benefit from:

Exceptional Team: Join a team of professional and highly ambitious colleagues who continuously set the bar high, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the energy trading market. We do not use either SAFe or Scrum but follow a Kanban-style iterative approach towards agility. We fight technical debt and muda, mura and muri in every process.
Thrilling growth environment: Be a part of a young and rapidly growing company with an authentic start-up atmosphere. Here, your innovative ideas will be celebrated, and your contributions will be recognized.
Impact: Be part of a visionary organization driving positive change in the energy sector, and impact how we become more technology driven as an organization.
Attractive compensation: Receive a competitive salary package with benefits.
Flexible Work Arrangements: We value work-life balance and offer the freedom to work from the comfort of your own home.
Social and Professional Events: Enjoy a well-rounded work experience with various social and professional events, including sports activities and parties, fostering a strong team spirit and camaraderie.




About Us

Copenhagen Energy Trading A/S was founded in 2021 and is part of Copenhagen Energy Group.




We specialize in short-term proprietary wholesale power trading in Europe. We work with modern technologies, and we have the best people working with us. Data and advanced analytics fuel our deep insights into the electricity markets and enable us to develop discretionary as well as system-based trading strategies that move power to where it is needed the most.




Since we believe in a culture of collaborative growth, we do not have a system of bureaucratic policies or rigid hierarchy. We support a strong sense of team spirit, surrounded by a like-minded team and an easy-going work culture.




Next steps

All applicants are welcome. At Copenhagen Energy Trading we believe that diversity, equality, and inclusion are fundamental in the creation of an inspirational workplace that enables us to be innovative and creative. For more information you are welcome to contact Jens Christian Johannsen jcj@copenhagen-energy.com.

Title: Data Scientist med fokus på infrastruktur og udvikling af modeller
Place: Brøndby Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you speak data? No, I speak Python.




Perfekt. Så er du scrollet til det helt rigtige sted i dit feed. Vi vil gerne låne 2 min af din tid til at overbevise dig om, at du skal være vores nye Data Scientist hos Danske Spil.




”Vi vælger at gå på arbejde hver dag, ikke bare fordi vi skal, men fordi vi oprigtigt kan lide hinanden og trives i hinandens selskab. Vi er fagligt ambitiøse og fokuserede, men vi har også masser af grin og et fantastisk sammenhold. Vores dygtige data engineers sørger for al data tilrettelæggelse, så vi i Data Science kan fokusere på de reelle data science opgaver og skabe værdi gennem vores arbejde og ekspertise.” – Trine Brandt, Leder af Data Science




Velkommen til Data Science i Danske Spil

I vores Data Science afdeling arbejder vi målrettet på at udvikle og forbedre vores modeller og infrastruktur for at sikre, at vi kan levere de bedste spil- og underholdningsoplevelser til vores kunder. Data Science er et team bestående af fire data scientists, en tech lead samt en product owner. Vi er en del af BI & Data Science afdelingen med 20 kollegaer, der alle er bundet sammen af vores passion for data. Vores ambition er at levere state-of-the-art machine learning løsninger inden for anti-hvidvask, identifikation af problematisk spilleadfærd og relevant kundedialog i vores produkt- og marketingafdelinger. Vi har et unikt datasæt både i omfang og kvalitet, og vi brænder for at bruge det aktivt til ansvarlige og fornuftige forretningsbeslutninger.




Lidt om dig, dit ansvar og dine opgaver

Vi søger en erfaren og samarbejdende Data Scientist, der kan tage ansvar for vores infrastruktur og udvikling af modeller i et scrum setup. Du trives med at arbejde sammen med dygtige kollegaer og er ikke bange for at dele din viden og lære fra dig. Kendskab til vores produkter er ikke et krav, men det er selvfølgelig en fordel, hvis du har hørt om Danske Spil.




Din profil:

Du har en stærk baggrund inden for data science og modellering.
Du ”taler” flydende Python.
Du har gode samarbejdsevner, en god portion nysgerrighed og erfaring med at arbejde i scrum setup.
Du har nogle års erfaring på arbejdsmarkedet indenfor Data Science.
Du har erfaring med machine learning i et cloud setup – gerne i Azure og/eller Databricks.
Du er stærk til MLOps – især CI/CD machine learning pipelines og container løsninger.
Du er en profil der ønsker at drive leverancer.




Dine opgaver:

Indgå i teamets arbejde med udvikling, drift og eventuelle bugs på vores prædiktive og generative modeller.
Ansvar for udvikling og vedligeholdelse af vores data science infrastruktur.
Udvikling og implementering af nye modeller og algoritmer.
Analyse af komplekse datasæt og præsentation af resultater til ledelsen.
Indgå i dialog med både forretningen og tekniske medarbejdere om relevant data til specifikke problemer.
Kommunikere modellernes performance og bagvedliggende metode bredt i organisationen.
Arbejde iterativt og agilt med et ”Fail fast”-mindset.
Bidrage til optimering og effektivisering af vores data science processer.




Vil du være med til at underholde danskerne?

Vi læser ansøgninger igennem og indkalder til samtaler løbende, men deadline for at søge er til og med den 20. oktober. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af Data Science Trine Brandt på tbra@danskespil.dk. Hvis du har spørgsmål til rekrutteringsprocessen, er du velkommen til at kontakte HR Business Partner, Majbritt Storm Lindegaard på masb@danskespil.dk.




Vi glæder os til at møde dig,

Hilsen dine nye teammedlemmer Philip, Hakan, Marie Louise, Jakob, Pia, Tryggvi og Trine

Show more

Vil du være med til at underholde danskerne?

Vi glæder os til at møde dig,

Hilsen dine nye teammedlemmer Philip, Hakan, Marie Louise, Jakob, Pia, Tryggvi og Trine

Title: Python Backend Developer - Remote
Description:
Location: Latin America/Europe - Permanent Remote

Experience: 6 - 15 Years

Role Type: Contracting Full Time (40 Hrs/week)

Overlap Hours: 8 Hours PST time

Contract Duration: 3-6 Months

Mandatory Skills

Python- 5 years,

Django- 5 years,

SQL-5 years.

Hands-on experience with the AWS cloud is mandatory

Total years of exp- 6+ years experience mandatory

Required Skills


7+ years of experience in software development - ( Purely backend )
Coding experience in server-side programming languages (e.g. Python, Go, Java, Ruby) as well as database languages (SQL)
Experience working with server-side MVC frameworks (e.g. Django, .NET, Spring, Rails, Phoenix)
Past experience and success in building and supporting scalable APIs, services, or applications
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.
Deep understanding of customer needs and passion for customer success.
Exhibit core behaviors focused on craftsmanship, continuous improvement, and team success
Ability to look ahead to identify opportunities, foster a culture of innovation, and build for scale.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


About The Role

A globally recognised firm is seeking a talented and experienced Senior Backend Engineer to join their Carriers team! The Carriers team is responsible for developing new features, building infrastructure and maintaining current services. As a Senior Engineer, he/she will provide leadership and oversight in technical design, systems architecture, and coding for their team and the Engineering team.

Responsibility

Design, implement, test, and deploy software services with high SLAs that can handle millions of requests a day.


Ensure scalability and maintainability through microservices adoption, decoupling of concerns from the data model, queuing of jobs, application layering and container-based software distribution.
Continue to build out and enhance our CI/CD pipeline for smooth and safe production releases via automated testing and verification.
Verify and ensure performance and correctness of systems in response time and throughput.
Architect systems and refactor existing systems for optimal performance and reuse
Participate in peer reviews, testing and in design reviews for new features, products, and systems
Collaborate with business teams and provide early input to new product ideas and functionality
Define, implement, and monitor operational metrics to ensure performance and quality.
Work with a sense of urgency and iterate quickly in an agile process.
Mentor more junior engineers on engineering best practices.
Exceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to understand business challenges and translate those into technical solutions.

HTML:
Location: Latin America/Europe - Permanent Remote

Experience: 6 - 15 Years

Role Type: Contracting Full Time (40 Hrs/week)

Overlap Hours: 8 Hours PST time

Contract Duration: 3-6 Months

Mandatory Skills

Python- 5 years,

Django- 5 years,

SQL-5 years.

Hands-on experience with the AWS cloud is mandatory

Total years of exp- 6+ years experience mandatory

Required Skills

  • 7+ years of experience in software development - ( Purely backend )
  • Coding experience in server-side programming languages (e.g. Python, Go, Java, Ruby) as well as database languages (SQL)
  • Experience working with server-side MVC frameworks (e.g. Django, .NET, Spring, Rails, Phoenix)
  • Past experience and success in building and supporting scalable APIs, services, or applications
  • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.
  • Deep understanding of customer needs and passion for customer success.
  • Exhibit core behaviors focused on craftsmanship, continuous improvement, and team success
  • Ability to look ahead to identify opportunities, foster a culture of innovation, and build for scale.
  • Excellent spoken and written English communication skills

About The Role

A globally recognised firm is seeking a talented and experienced Senior Backend Engineer to join their Carriers team! The Carriers team is responsible for developing new features, building infrastructure and maintaining current services. As a Senior Engineer, he/she will provide leadership and oversight in technical design, systems architecture, and coding for their team and the Engineering team.

Responsibility

Design, implement, test, and deploy software services with high SLAs that can handle millions of requests a day.

  • Ensure scalability and maintainability through microservices adoption, decoupling of concerns from the data model, queuing of jobs, application layering and container-based software distribution.
  • Continue to build out and enhance our CI/CD pipeline for smooth and safe production releases via automated testing and verification.
  • Verify and ensure performance and correctness of systems in response time and throughput.
  • Architect systems and refactor existing systems for optimal performance and reuse
  • Participate in peer reviews, testing and in design reviews for new features, products, and systems
  • Collaborate with business teams and provide early input to new product ideas and functionality
  • Define, implement, and monitor operational metrics to ensure performance and quality.
  • Work with a sense of urgency and iterate quickly in an agile process.
  • Mentor more junior engineers on engineering best practices.
  • Exceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to understand business challenges and translate those into technical solutions.

Title: Python Full Stack Developer
Description:
Python Full Stack Developer -JavaScript/Typescript

Experience: 3 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with the PST time zone

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years experience

Mandatory Skills-

Python: min 3 yrs,

JavaScript: min 3 yrs or Typescript: min 3 yrs,

Nest.js: min 1 yr, or React: min 2 yrs

Required Skills


3+ years of professional experience in Python
Strong SQL expertise with hands-on experience in database design, optimization, and management.
2+ years of experience with Nest JS or other backend frameworks.
Familiarity with AWS/GCP is a plus.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team.
Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering high-quality code.


Nice to Have : Familiarity with front-end technologies (React or Angular) is a plus.

Familiarity with Python for scripting data analysis is a plus.


Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Job Description

We are seeking a full-stack engineer with a strong focus on backend development to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-performance software applications. Your expertise in Python and JavaScript (JS) will be crucial in building scalable and reliable backend systems.

Ideal Candidate Profile


3+ years of overall experience
Eager to learn and grow within the company, with a proactive approach to personal and professional development.
Reliable and consistent in delivering high-quality work.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.


Skills: python,full stack development,aws/gcp,html,javascript/typescript,gcp,nestjs,nest.js,angular,aws,javascript,react,sql,css,typescript
