Title: R&D Scientist - Applied Food Protection Research
Description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a highly motivated Scientist in Food Science Research to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in food science and a passion for innovation in the food industry, preferably with knowledge about antimicrobials and their interaction with food matrices.


Understand different food matrices and their interactions with antimicrobials to design and conduct antimicrobial screenings in applications.
Collaborate closely with R&D and application colleagues in a multicultural environment to address customer and matrix requirements.
Utilize blending techniques to create new and improved food protection formulations.
Employ high-throughput methods for efficient and rapid testing of food samples.
Support the scale-up process to production and assist in supply chain management and regulatory review.
Write technical reports and present findings to key stakeholders.
Review patents and scientific articles and propose research initiatives aligned with business strategies and market trends.
Conduct data analysis to interpret results and drive decision-making processes.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in food science and apply this knowledge to ongoing projects.


Required Experience And Skills


The ideal candidate should hold at least a MSc in Food Science, Microbiology, or a related field.
Proficiency in techniques related to screening is necessary.
A couple of years of experience in project management is essential. Ideally, this experience should be gained in a food company.
Experience in high-throughput experimentation for antimicrobial efficacy testing.
Proficiency in statistical data analysis.
Self-motivation and the ability to take ownership of tasks and adapt to changing situations.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills for collaboration.
Strong ability to work in a cross-functional team environment.


We are a global leader in taste, scent, and nutrition, offering our customers a broader range of natural solutions and accelerating our growth strategy. At IFF, we believe that your uniqueness unleashes our potential. We value the diverse mosaic of the ethnicity, national origin, race, age, sex, or veteran status. We strive for an inclusive workplace that allows each of our colleagues to bring their authentic self to work regardless of their religion, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, or disability.

Visit IFF.com/careers/workplace-diversity-and-inclusion to learn more

Title: Senior manager, Data scientist in Corporate Finance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

This role is a strong opportunity to elevate digitalization in financial planning in the LEGO Group and to gain E2E knowledge on the LEGO Group's financial processes and grow a strong network across the organization!

As part of the Corporate reporting and planning team, you will play a key role in using data and drive innovation and continuous improvement in the financial planning processes and build on your already excellent finance data scientist career!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position


Core Responsibilities





Drive the aspiration on business analysis and push the data focus in defining the new financial planning processes
Leverage data driven forecasting in financial planning e.g. via driver-based planning, predictive planning and sensible machine learning to drive automation and reduced cycle time with less effort
Engage with partners across Finance to drive the implementation and support the change journey
Be one of the subject matter experts training and supporting colleagues building confidence in the data driven approach
Co-drive validation and recommendation on the model selection in a new forecast engine in collaboration with the technical developers
Prepare the reporting supporting transparency in the models and building a storyline on the development




Play your part in our team succeeding

Do you have what it takes?

We expect our preferred candidate to hold a Master's degree in Data science/Data engineering/ Economics / Finance or similar





5-8 years of experience with data science or data engineering, preferably with a focus on finance
Strong analytical skills and experience with predictive planning/ machine learning /Python/R or similar
Superb communication and collaboration skills
Location in Billund or Copenhagen office




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

HTML:
Job Description

This role is a strong opportunity to elevate digitalization in financial planning in the LEGO Group and to gain E2E knowledge on the LEGO Group's financial processes and grow a strong network across the organization!

As part of the Corporate reporting and planning team, you will play a key role in using data and drive innovation and continuous improvement in the financial planning processes and build on your already excellent finance data scientist career!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position


Core Responsibilities



  • Drive the aspiration on business analysis and push the data focus in defining the new financial planning processes
  • Leverage data driven forecasting in financial planning e.g. via driver-based planning, predictive planning and sensible machine learning to drive automation and reduced cycle time with less effort
  • Engage with partners across Finance to drive the implementation and support the change journey
  • Be one of the subject matter experts training and supporting colleagues building confidence in the data driven approach
  • Co-drive validation and recommendation on the model selection in a new forecast engine in collaboration with the technical developers
  • Prepare the reporting supporting transparency in the models and building a storyline on the development



Play your part in our team succeeding

Do you have what it takes?

We expect our preferred candidate to hold a Master's degree in Data science/Data engineering/ Economics / Finance or similar



  • 5-8 years of experience with data science or data engineering, preferably with a focus on finance
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with predictive planning/ machine learning /Python/R or similar
  • Superb communication and collaboration skills
  • Location in Billund or Copenhagen office



Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Brænder du for Artificial Intelligence og Machine Learning, og har du lyst til at forbedre kundeoplevelsen og interne processer gennem avancerede datamodeller?




”Hej, jeg hedder Henri, og jeg er leder for afdelingen Data & Insights, hvor vi arbejder med data for at skabe indsigt og drive strategiske beslutninger på tværs af Magasin. Vi er på udkig efter en AI Specialist, der til en start skal hjælpe os med at berige vores produktdata gennem udvikling af ML modeller, herunder brug af både LLM’er og Computer Vision for at sikre høj kvalitet, konsistens og brugerværdi i produktattributter, hvilket forbedrer kundeoplevelsen.”




Du vil arbejde tæt sammen med et stærkt team bestående af BI-specialister, dataingeniører, webanalytikere og indsigtsspecialister for at sikre, at vi udnytter AI og ML til fulde i vores data- og forretningsstrategi.







Din hverdag i Magasin

I Magasin kan du se frem til en dynamisk hverdag, med fart over feltet. Som AI Specialist hos os vil dine primære arbejdsopgaver være:

Udvikling, træning og implementering af machine learning-modeller, der beriger produktdata, forbedrer datakvaliteten og sikrer konsistens i produktattributter
Anvendelse af LLM’er og Computer Vision-modeller til at øge produktattributters brugerværdi og præcision
Samarbejde med forretningsenheder for at identificere potentielle AI-løsninger, der kan forbedre kundeoplevelsen og optimere data
Sikre at AI-modeller integreres i vores eksisterende datastrukturer og understøtter vores overordnede forretningsstrategi
Løbende evaluering og optimering af modeller for at sikre performance og relevans
Udnyttelse af vores Azure-infrastruktur til udvikling og skalering af AI-løsninger







Du er vigtig for os

.. fordi du med din viden er med til at udvikle og implementere skræddersyede løsninger, som optimerer vores produktdata og driver vores forretningsmæssige succes som en af Danmarks førende retailere. Vi leder efter dig, der har:

Erfaring med at udvikle og implementere ML-modeller, herunder LLM’er og Computer Vision
Stærk viden om Python eller lignende programmeringssprog anvendt til AI-udvikling
Erfaring med cloud-platforme, særligt Microsoft Azure, og evnen til at udnytte platformens muligheder for AI og ML
Interesse for at forstå komplekse forretningsbehov og omdanne dem til tekniske løsninger
Erfaring med at arbejde med store datamængder og sikre datakvalitet gennem automatiserede processer
Evnen til at samarbejde på tværs af forskellige teams og drive projekter fremad







Mig som leder

Jeg lægger stor vægt på samarbejde og fælles ansvar. Jeg forventer, at du engagerer dig fuldt ud i at skabe løsninger, der gør en forskel for vores kunder. Du vil have rig mulighed for at eksperimentere og anvende dine færdigheder inden for AI i tæt dialog med resten af teamet, men det er også dit ansvar at sikre, at vi løbende når vores mål.




Vi ser frem til at byde en ny AI Specialist velkommen til vores team, og jeg glæder mig til at læse din ansøgning.




De bedste hilsner,




Henri Legentil-Borup

Head of Data & Insights







Vil du søge jobbet?

Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler, og går du videre i processen, skal du igennem flere steps, hvor både du og vi vurderer, om denne stilling er det rigtige match for dig og Magasin. Hos os kan du blive inviteret til videointerview, samtaler med både HR, leder og ansættende direktør i et forløb på 1-2 måneder. Som en del af processen bruger vi personprofiler, problemløsningstest og faglige cases alt sammen for at sikre det optimale match for begge parter. Vi ser frem til i sidste ende at byde den helt rette kandidat velkommen i magiske Magasin.

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further.

Does this sound highly appealing to you? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Researcher at Alipes Capital.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




To accomplish our mission of being the best at what we do, we understand the importance of elevating our predictive modeling standards to the highest levels. Your work will involve leading the efforts in creating a world class modeling workflow, enabling the team to seamlessly turn massive data sets of financial information into mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the financial markets.




In doing so, you will get a chance to tackle a variety of software infrastructure challenges, such as:

Development and optimization of calibration and benchmarking frameworks
Building out and implementing best practices for data preparation and dataset generation pipelines
Prototyping and releasing novel predictive architectures, especially with respect to time-series models.




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.




About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering 6 nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About you

Fluency within mathematics and statistics
Experience working with the full Machine Learning stack from data generation through model calibration and real-life validation and monitoring
Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
Proficiency with computer science fundamentals
A scientific and inquisitive mind




Nice to have

Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Programming experience with languages like C# and C/C++
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics or economics




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Title: DATA SCIENCE CONSULTANT COPENHAGEN
Description:
Role:




Statistical data processing (Data Mining)
Artificial Intelligence (AI), including generative AI
Predictive modeling using Machine Learning and Data Science techniques
Time-series modeling (ARIMA and panel data models) and simulation models (Monte Carlo)
Development, validation and audit of financial, risk, marketing and business-oriented models
R&D projects




Requirements:




Recent graduates or final year students.
Should desirably have knowledge of Artificial Intelligence modeling techniques (logit, GLM, time series, random forests, clustering, XGBoost), statistical programming languages (SAS, R, Python, Matlab), big data tools and platforms (Hadoop, Hive, etc.) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Solid academic record.
Strong computer skills.
Postgraduate studies and/or specialized courses are an asset, especially in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Quantitative Finance or similar.
Knowledge of other languages is desirable.
Get-up-and-go attitude, maturity, responsibility and strong work ethic.
Strong ability to learn quickly.
Able to integrate easily into multidisciplinary teams.




What we offer:




We offer you the possibility to join a firm that provides all you need to develop your talent to the fullest:




Working in the highest-profile consulting projects in the industry,
for the largest companies, leaders of their respective markets,
alongside top industry management as they face challenges at the national and global level,
as part of an extraordinary team of professionals whose values and corporate culture are a benchmark for the industry




Training:

Ongoing training plan, with approximately 10% of business turnover spent on training.
Specialist knowledge courses, external expert courses, professional skills courses and language courses.
Last year our staff as a whole received over 350,000 hours of training spanning more than 150 courses.




Career plan:

Clearly defined career plan.
Internal promotion based solely on merit.
Partnership-based management model offers all professionals the opportunity to become part of the Firm’s group of partners




Complementary experiences:




University: we maintain a close relationship with the world’s most prestigious universities.
Social Action: we organize more than 30 community support activities.
Sports Club: internal and external tournaments.




How to apply:




If you are interested in our offer, please complete our application form online at https://www.managementsolutions.com/en/professional-careers-send-us-your-cv

Title: Python Developer - LLM
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 3 - 6 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

Title: Data Scientist & Startup Founder (March 2025)
Description:
This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.




Who you are:

You are a highly skilled technical professional with a proven track record in developing innovative solutions. Your strong programming abilities and experience in building complex algorithms enable you to address critical challenges within the tech industry. You are a proactive individual with a passion for progress, driven to make a significant impact through cutting-edge technological advancements.




The Antler Founder Residency

Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.

12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Copenhagen.
Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!




Program Details

Start Date: March 3rd, 2025
Location: Onsite at our Copenhagen office
Compensation: While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
Visa Sponsorship: Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.




For our March 2025 cohort, we're looking for someone who:

Excel in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI, with a knack for advancing technology.
Can unearth insights from intricate data, leading in ML methodologies.
Embrace the challenge of merging diverse data for revolutionary models.
Are adept at prototyping innovative solutions that pave the way for real-world applications.
Navigate product development with strategic foresight and precision.
Experienced in the start-up ecosystem
Optional: have an idea that solves a problem you’re passionate about, but you understand the need for co-pilots who share your vision and values




Application Process

Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:

Apply through our website.
Participate in an introductory interview.
Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
Receive a potential offer.




Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:

Wingbits: A community-driven flight data tracking platform
Two: A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
Evyon: A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
Glint Solar: Software accelerating the identification of optimal solar installation sites.
PerPlant: AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

  • Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!


Program Details

  • Start Date: March 3rd, 2025
  • Location: Onsite at our Copenhagen office
  • Compensation: While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
  • Visa Sponsorship: Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.


For our March 2025 cohort, we're looking for someone who:

  • Excel in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI, with a knack for advancing technology.
  • Can unearth insights from intricate data, leading in ML methodologies.
  • Embrace the challenge of merging diverse data for revolutionary models.
  • Are adept at prototyping innovative solutions that pave the way for real-world applications.
  • Navigate product development with strategic foresight and precision.
  • Experienced in the start-up ecosystem
  • Optional: have an idea that solves a problem you’re passionate about, but you understand the need for co-pilots who share your vision and values


Application Process

Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:

  1. Apply through our website.
  2. Participate in an introductory interview.
  3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
  4. Receive a potential offer.


Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:

  • Wingbits: A community-driven flight data tracking platform
  • Two: A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
  • Evyon: A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
  • Glint Solar: Software accelerating the identification of optimal solar installation sites.
  • PerPlant: AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

Title: Software Engineer to ALTEN Denmark
Description:
Are you a talented Software Engineer seeking your next opportunity? Join our Engineering team in Denmark, where exciting challenges await!

Your role as Software Engineer:

As a Software Engineer at ALTEN, you will play a key role in strengthening the section for integration of software and hardware. You will be a part of a talented team where you develop state of the art technology together with electronics engineers, firmware and software developers.

Who are you?

To be a good match for the role we we believe that you have a great experience in C++, it could be both close to the hardware or object oriented. Experience in C is also of interest. You are a driven and engaged colleague with a problem-solving mind and a team player. We also see that you have a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, or other equivalent education and at least 5+ years of experience within a relevant area.




We also think our new colleague have experience from:

Python or Java
SQL
Machine learning (TensorFloe, Scikit-learn)
Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google cloud)




It is meritorious if you also have:

experience of UX design
experience working with control algorithms
experience of version control systems




Location: Aarhus, Denmark.




The recruitment process is ongoing- if you are interested do not hesitate to apply right away!




As part of our team, you can expect the following:

Full-time employment at ALTEN Denmark

Opportunities for international mobility

Access to internal education, certifications, and professional development programs offered by ALTEN Academy

Diverse range of assignments with different clients and industries

Career coaching and guidance with the support of our dedicated Business Managers




About ALTEN:

ALTEN is a leading provider of outsourced Engineering and Technology Services, operating in over 35 countries with a workforce of more than 57,000 employees. In Denmark, ALTEN has been on a successful growth trajectory since 2019, delivering innovative solutions within Engineering and Life Science. Our team of skilled engineers undertakes complex and technically demanding projects across various industries, collaborating with renowned companies throughout the value chain and are presented in various locations in Denmark!

Title: Experienced Data Scientist
Description:
Be a key player for the success of our cutting-edge AI healthcare products.

Are you a passionate data scientist with a desire to make an impact in the healthcare sector? Systematic Healthcare is seeking an experienced Data Scientist to develop cutting-edge AI for our healthcare products. As a Data Scientist, you will be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge AI and machine learning models, ensuring seamless integration with our healthcare products. Join us and become part of a dynamic team that simplifies critical decision-making for healthcare professionals worldwide.

About Our Team
At Systematic, we foster a supportive and collaborative work environment where your contributions are valued and encouraged. We believe in nurturing talent and providing ample opportunities for career growth. You will be working close together with other data scientists and architects. The team is based on informal communication and mutual trust in each other’s expertise.

Build AI solutions for Systematic Healthcare
In Systematic, our mission is to have a positive impact on the world stage by supporting our customers in critical decision making in critical environments. We are looking for new team members that can help contribute to our mission. Here, you will come across exciting challenges that are unique to our domain.

You will be part of shaping the future of our AI innovation and development of healthcare products in this hands-on Data Scientist role. You will contribute as a key player to innovation around ML/AI for our healthcare products, introducing novel capabilities and overall product enhancements.

Key responsibilities:


Work with a variety of machine learning tasks such as natural language processing, speech recognition, anomaly detection and more
Be involved in all phases of the data science workflow including clarification, experimentation, modelling, testing, communicating, and deploying data driven solutions
Collaborate with product managers, product owners and domain experts
Participate in technical sparring sessions and code inspections
Think innovatively by coming up with ideas and improvements



About You
To thrive in this role, you should bring a few years of experience and curiosity to the table.

We are looking for candidates who possesses the following qualifications:


Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks model development (e.g. PyTorch and Tensorflow)
Experience with LLM and prompting
Solid understanding of model evaluation, documentation, visualization of data-driven solutions and development best-practices
Experience with Docker and FastAPI
Appreciate teamwork and sparring
Great communication skills
Proficient in English



Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club offering almost 100 social/professional events a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Jacob Elgaard Manager.

Get in touch

Sofie Heiner Emborg

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more

Title: Python Developer - LLM
Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 3 - 6 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

Title: Python Full Stack Developer
Description:
Python Full Stack Developer -JavaScript/Typescript

Experience: 3 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with the PST time zone

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years experience

Mandatory Skills-

Python: min 3 yrs,

JavaScript: min 3 yrs or Typescript: min 3 yrs,

Nest.js: min 1 yr, or React: min 2 yrs

Required Skills


3+ years of professional experience in Python
Strong SQL expertise with hands-on experience in database design, optimization, and management.
2+ years of experience with Nest JS or other backend frameworks.
Familiarity with AWS/GCP is a plus.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team.
Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering high-quality code.


Nice to Have : Familiarity with front-end technologies (React or Angular) is a plus.

Familiarity with Python for scripting data analysis is a plus.


Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Job Description

We are seeking a full-stack engineer with a strong focus on backend development to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-performance software applications. Your expertise in Python and JavaScript (JS) will be crucial in building scalable and reliable backend systems.

Ideal Candidate Profile


3+ years of overall experience
Eager to learn and grow within the company, with a proactive approach to personal and professional development.
Reliable and consistent in delivering high-quality work.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.


Skills: python,full stack development,aws/gcp,html,javascript/typescript,gcp,nestjs,nest.js,angular,aws,javascript,react,sql,css,typescript

Title: R&D Scientist - Applied Food Protection Research
Description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a highly motivated Scientist in Food Science Research to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in food science and a passion for innovation in the food industry, preferably with knowledge about antimicrobials and their interaction with food matrices.


Understand different food matrices and their interactions with antimicrobials to design and conduct antimicrobial screenings in applications.
Collaborate closely with R&D and application colleagues in a multicultural environment to address customer and matrix requirements.
Utilize blending techniques to create new and improved food protection formulations.
Employ high-throughput methods for efficient and rapid testing of food samples.
Support the scale-up process to production and assist in supply chain management and regulatory review.
Write technical reports and present findings to key stakeholders.
Review patents and scientific articles and propose research initiatives aligned with business strategies and market trends.
Conduct data analysis to interpret results and drive decision-making processes.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in food science and apply this knowledge to ongoing projects.


Required Experience And Skills


The ideal candidate should hold at least a MSc in Food Science, Microbiology, or a related field.
Proficiency in techniques related to screening is necessary.
A couple of years of experience in project management is essential. Ideally, this experience should be gained in a food company.
Experience in high-throughput experimentation for antimicrobial efficacy testing.
Proficiency in statistical data analysis.
Self-motivation and the ability to take ownership of tasks and adapt to changing situations.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills for collaboration.
Strong ability to work in a cross-functional team environment.


We are a global leader in taste, scent, and nutrition, offering our customers a broader range of natural solutions and accelerating our growth strategy. At IFF, we believe that your uniqueness unleashes our potential. We value the diverse mosaic of the ethnicity, national origin, race, age, sex, or veteran status. We strive for an inclusive workplace that allows each of our colleagues to bring their authentic self to work regardless of their religion, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, or disability.

Visit IFF.com/careers/workplace-diversity-and-inclusion to learn more

Title: Senior manager, Data scientist in Corporate Finance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

This role is a strong opportunity to elevate digitalization in financial planning in the LEGO Group and to gain E2E knowledge on the LEGO Group's financial processes and grow a strong network across the organization!

As part of the Corporate reporting and planning team, you will play a key role in using data and drive innovation and continuous improvement in the financial planning processes and build on your already excellent finance data scientist career!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position


Core Responsibilities





Drive the aspiration on business analysis and push the data focus in defining the new financial planning processes
Leverage data driven forecasting in financial planning e.g. via driver-based planning, predictive planning and sensible machine learning to drive automation and reduced cycle time with less effort
Engage with partners across Finance to drive the implementation and support the change journey
Be one of the subject matter experts training and supporting colleagues building confidence in the data driven approach
Co-drive validation and recommendation on the model selection in a new forecast engine in collaboration with the technical developers
Prepare the reporting supporting transparency in the models and building a storyline on the development




Play your part in our team succeeding

Do you have what it takes?

We expect our preferred candidate to hold a Master's degree in Data science/Data engineering/ Economics / Finance or similar





5-8 years of experience with data science or data engineering, preferably with a focus on finance
Strong analytical skills and experience with predictive planning/ machine learning /Python/R or similar
Superb communication and collaboration skills
Location in Billund or Copenhagen office




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Cloud Lab Scientist
Place: Måløv, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Have you got experience optimizing wet lab-based processes? Do you possess a high-throughput mindset for data gathering? We are looking for scientists to help us acquire large amounts of quality data through externalization of research. If this sounds exciting, then this could be the right opportunity for you.

Apply today for a life-changing career!

The Position
As a Cloud Lab Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in conducting outsourced scientific research using Contract Research Organizations (CROs) and Cloud Labs. This position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge science and innovation. Specifically, we seek to supplement internal datasets with large amounts of structured data made for bespoke purposes. You will be responsible for acquiring this data – not in our labs, but with remote vendors!

Some of your key responsibilities will be:



Outsourcing research in support of biopharmaceutical science.
Using your experience in recombinant protein production or peptide synthesis, to ensure timely deliveries from external vendors.
Set and control quality measurements in terms of advanced biophysical and in vitro assays.
Apply quality mindset to balance speed and quality of delivered results.
Collaborate effectively with CROs and cloud lab partners.
Ensure timely and successful completion through stakeholder management and good communicative skills.
A keen eye for details to direct concrete scientific work with cloud lab partners.
Present results to stakeholders, internal and external, with clarity and precision.




The seniority level of the position will be decided based on the chosen candidates’ qualifications and experience. We welcome people of all experience levels to apply and grow with us.

No relocation package can be offered for this opportunity.

Qualifications

To thrive and succeed in this position we would expect you to recognize yourself in the below:



You have a PhD-degree in molecular biology, chemistry, biophysics, biomedical research or similar. Industry experience in a relevant scientific discipline could be an advantage.
You are experienced with general laboratory procedures and experimentation, with familiarity in recombinant protein production or peptide synthesis, including purification and QC.
You are familiar with scripting or high-level programming languages such as Python, C# or similar.
You have experience in acquisition of large data amounts from high throughput screenings or other approaches such as DoE.
It would be beneficial if you have experience from Cloud Labs, such as Emeral Cloud Lab.




As a person, you are curious and open-minded to new ideas, people, and challenges. You have excellent communication skills, and you thrive working in a cross-functional, multi-disciplinary setting. You are a good team player, who consistently engages in constructive collaborations and values collaboration and knowledge sharing. Your passion for science and ability to impact and progress projects inspires those around you.

As this job will involve collaboration across the globe, we will offer flexible work time to ensure a healthy work/life balance.

About The Department

You'll be joining our Digital Science & Innovation team, which supports the digital journey across all our therapy areas in Research & Early Development (R&ED). We work in multidisciplinary teams and collaborate with all areas across R&ED to leverage scientific knowledge, partner with our IT organization to ensure access to the most advanced technology platforms and tools and engage in drug development projects across the value chain. We're focused on developing and retaining top talent. In the department of Automation and Process Optimisation we enable our skilled scientists to acquire data for training of advanced machine learning algorithms with cutting-edge automation solutions.

Working at Novo Nordisk
Novo Nordisk is a leading global healthcare company with a 100-year legacy of driving change to defeat serious chronic diseases. Building on our strong legacy within diabetes, we are growing massively and expanding our commitment, reaching millions around the world and impacting more than 40 million patient lives daily. All of this has made us one of the 20 most valuable companies in the world by market cap. Our success relies on the joint potential and collaboration of our more than 63,000 employees around the world. We recognize the importance of the unique skills and perspectives our people bring to the table, and we work continuously to bring out the best in them. Working at Novo Nordisk, we're working toward something bigger than ourselves, and it's a collective effort. Join us! Together, we go further. Together, we're life changing.

Contact
For further information please contact Søren Bertelsen, Director Process Optimisation, at sqbl@novonordisk.com.

Deadline
21 October 2024.

Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo to your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

Title: Join Our Device Testing Panel and Earn EUR 10/hour!
Description:
Earn money simply by using your phone.

At OptikosPrime, we are developing mobile apps to enable easy eye testing using only smartphones. We occasionally need help testing features on specific phone models as part of our testing process.

We pay EUR 10 per hour every time we engage someone from our testing panel. Although a test typically takes less than 20 minutes, we pay for a full hour regardless.

If you want to join our panel, the application process is simple.

Just apply for the job, and we will send you a form where you can provide some basic information, including the exact phone model you have.

We will contact you as soon as we need to test your model.

Title: Senior/Lead AI Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who are we?

Flowtale is a Data and AI company based in Copenhagen, on a journey, from being a Consultancy company going towards a product company. We collaborate with top-tier corporations across the Nordics, focusing on innovative AI projects. In addition to this we also develop GenAI solutions, of which we currently have the products Charlie (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fd5mpE-cPeM&ab_channel=FlowTaleDemos), and FlowForm (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jkIWTj73JNU).




Our team excels in handling big data and crafting bespoke data engineering solutions. We encourage pioneering approaches and continuously push boundaries in the AI domain, working closely with clients to deliver impactful results. Joining Flowtale means becoming part of a dedicated team in a growing firm, where your contributions significantly shape our future.




Job Description

Flowtale is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior/Lead AI Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software engineering with a specialized focus on AI technologies. As a pivotal member of our team, you will be responsible for the design, development, and deployment of innovative software solutions as web-services.




Key Responsibilities:

- Lead the design and development of AI-driven software solutions for customers as well as internally

- Be able to translate business requirements into technical solutions

- Manage the complete software development lifecycle, from inception to deployment.

- Utilize Python to develop robust and scalable applications.

- Implement version control practices using Git and GitLab.

- Collaborate within a small, agile team environment to drive project success.

- Independently study and implement solutions based on software documentation.

- Follow and apply architectural design principles to ensure high-quality deliverables.




Qualifications:

- Extensive experience in software engineering, with a proven track record of developing and releasing products.

- Proficiency in Python, with a deep understanding of its libraries and frameworks.

- Strong experience with version control systems, especially Git and GitLab.

- Capability to design and deploy complete web-service solutions.

- Ability to work autonomously and as part of a close-knit team.

- Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

- Enthusiasm for learning and implementing new technologies.

- Excellent communication skills.




Preferred Experience:

- A couple of years in a senior software engineering role.

- Experience in a leadership or mentoring capacity.




We offer a collaborative work environment in the beautiful setting of Islands Brygge and opportunities for professional growth. If you are passionate about AI and software engineering and enjoy working in a supportive team environment, we would love to hear from you.

Show more

Flowtale is a Data and AI company based in Copenhagen, on a journey, from being a Consultancy company going towards a product company. We collaborate with top-tier corporations across the Nordics, focusing on innovative AI projects. In addition to this we also develop GenAI solutions, of which we currently have the products Charlie (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fd5mpE-cPeM&ab_channel=FlowTaleDemos), and FlowForm (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jkIWTj73JNU).


Our team excels in handling big data and crafting bespoke data engineering solutions. We encourage pioneering approaches and continuously push boundaries in the AI domain, working closely with clients to deliver impactful results. Joining Flowtale means becoming part of a dedicated team in a growing firm, where your contributions significantly shape our future.


Job Description

Flowtale is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior/Lead AI Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software engineering with a specialized focus on AI technologies. As a pivotal member of our team, you will be responsible for the design, development, and deployment of innovative software solutions as web-services.


Key Responsibilities:

- Lead the design and development of AI-driven software solutions for customers as well as internally

- Be able to translate business requirements into technical solutions

- Manage the complete software development lifecycle, from inception to deployment.

- Utilize Python to develop robust and scalable applications.

- Implement version control practices using Git and GitLab.

- Collaborate within a small, agile team environment to drive project success.

- Independently study and implement solutions based on software documentation.

- Follow and apply architectural design principles to ensure high-quality deliverables.


Qualifications:

- Extensive experience in software engineering, with a proven track record of developing and releasing products.

- Proficiency in Python, with a deep understanding of its libraries and frameworks.

- Strong experience with version control systems, especially Git and GitLab.

- Capability to design and deploy complete web-service solutions.

- Ability to work autonomously and as part of a close-knit team.

- Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

- Enthusiasm for learning and implementing new technologies.

- Excellent communication skills.


Preferred Experience:

- A couple of years in a senior software engineering role.

- Experience in a leadership or mentoring capacity.


We offer a collaborative work environment in the beautiful setting of Islands Brygge and opportunities for professional growth. If you are passionate about AI and software engineering and enjoy working in a supportive team environment, we would love to hear from you.

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
TypeScript Engineer – Copenhagen – 50,000 – 60,000 DKK per month




We’ve partnered with a truly exciting tech business in Copenhagen, as they look to grow their software engineering team by another 25% this year!




The company definitely fall under the ‘tech for good’ umbrella – as they help businesses and consumers to make the transition into using electric vehicles. Because of the complexity of their industry, they have a variety of products on offer to their users.




They currently have a headcount of approximately 120 – with 45 of those being in the technology team! The goal this year is to increase the team by another 8-10 people, following the successful launch of a new platform.




You’ll be working on a hybrid model in their stylish Copenhagen HQ. Most of the team do three days per week in the office, but you can do anywhere between 2-5 depending on what works best for you!




The role




Due to the amount of greenfield work & new feature development that will be happening this year, the business are looking for both Full Stack & Backend Engineers! Their stack is TypeScript throughout so you will be utilizing the likes of Node, Nest.js, React, AWS and maybe even some React Native along the way!




You do not need to have experience in all of the above to be considered, so long as you have a strong background in TypeScript development.




The team you will be joining handles some of the most complex parts of the business’ technology, so you’ll need to be comfortable handling large-scale systems and taking ownership of features end to end when needed.




The process

Introductory call with Talent team
Call with hiring manager
Short coding challenge & meeting to review
In-person meeting to chat with the Founder & members of your new team.




On offer is up to 60,000 DKK per month plus incredibly strong pension, discretionary bonus, private healthcare and over 30 days of vacation per year!




Would you be interested in discussing this role with me?

Title: Solutions Engineer - North Europe
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

About CyberArk:

CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR), is the global leader in Identity Security. Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity – human or machine – across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world’s leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets. To learn more about CyberArk, visit our CyberArk blogs or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn or Facebook.

Job Description

CyberArk, is looking for a Solutions Engineer for Presales, covering the North Europe

In this role, you will combine technical knowledge with sales skills and are ultimately responsible for the technical win during the sales cycle. You are responsible for actively driving and managing the technology evaluation stage of the sales process which will require you to work with multiple stakeholders. You will match the customers/prospects business requirements to how the CyberArk Identity Security Platform can assist from a technical perspective. Therefore, you must be able to articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users. You must be able to identify all technical issues to assure complete customer satisfaction through all stages of the sales process.

Above all, we are looking for someone that can communicate the CyberArk value and be able to design an optimal solution for complex customer infrastructure and datacenter environments on a global scale.

To be successful, you must be comfortable in a dynamic atmosphere of a technical organization with a rapidly expanding customer base, possess strong communication and interpersonal skills as you will be required to build relationships across multiple levels of the organizations. Being organized, analytical & having the ability to eliminate sales obstacles through creative and adaptive approaches is also essential.

Responsibilities:



Provide technical pre-sales hands-on support.
Collaborate with Account Executives throughout the entire sales process.
Effectively present CyberArk’s technical value proposition to customers and partners.
Ensure the success of customer proof-of-concepts (POCs).
Respond to the functional and technical aspects of RFIs/RFPs.
Proactively seek new sales opportunities by developing technical relationships with prospective accounts.
Document client feature requests and issues in CyberArk internal systems.
Support CyberArk seminars and industry trade shows in the region.
Communicate customer requirements to Product Management teams.
Develop technical knowledge and skills of CyberArk solutions and related technologies.
Travel within the region (25%-50%). 



Qualifications



3+ years of experience as a Solutions Engineer and/or Professional Services Engineer, or equivalent experience.
High-level understanding of security concepts and the development of security roles within organizations that meet functional, technical, and regulatory requirements.
Strong hands-on technical abilities.
Hands-on experience with Windows Administration, Active Directory and Linux operating systems.
Knowledge in the leading cloud service providers: AWS, Azure, and GCP.
Understand complex customer environments and design optimal architectural solutions for them.
Fluent Danish and English language skills essential
What could set you apart as a top candidate:
Prior experience with CyberArk Identity Security solutions.
Experience in Privilege Access Management (PAM), Identity and Access Management (IAM), or Identity Management (IDM) solutions.
Knowledge and understanding of containerized environments and CI/CD toolchains.
Show more

Title: Sr Python Developer - LLM
Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 3 - 6 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.
